  • Growing lasting relationships with our clients, understanding their needs, and consistently delivering quality client services
  • Monitoring progress, managing risks and ensuring key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes
  • Developing specific technology skills relevant to engagement and project work
  • Continuously updating your understanding of current business and industry trends

To qualify for the role you must have:
  • Obtained or progress toward a bachelor’s degree in a relevant technology discipline, i.e. Computer Science, Computer or other technology-related Engineering, Information Systems, Information Technology, Statistics, Math, MIS
  • Desire to work in consulting demonstrated by relevant course work, interest or internship experience
  • Willingness and ability to learn and work independently with minimal supervision
  • Demonstrated project management, teaming, organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
  • Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to project deadlines
  • Integrity within a professional environment
  • The flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours when necessary
  • The understanding that when it is safe to do so, travel is an essential function of the job, may vary by location and can be up to 80%
  • Proficiency with MS Office, including MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint
  • A driver’s license valid in the U.S.
  • Candidates interested in the Government & Public Sector industry focus must have sole U.S. citizenship and be able to obtain and maintain a secret clearance or higher, within the designated timeframe, which will be determined by the engagement requirements for a security clearance
In addition to the above qualifications we are seeking candidates with an aptitude, interest, and/or experience in any of the following:
  • Development skills such as Java, Javascript, .Net, Python, C, C++, PHP, IoT development, or web development
  • Analytics focused tools and platforms including, but not limited to, SQL, R, Tableau, Power BI, and Spotfire
  • Business process design, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software, such as SAP or Oracle, or integration tools
What working at EY offers
We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.
Plus, we offer:
  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
  • Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams
About EY
As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark. Apply today

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

position: Summer Internship: Systems Engineering (Junior / Senior / Post Grad)
description:
Systems Engineering Internship – Indianapolis, IN – Junior, Senior and Post Graduate

Raytheon Intelligence and Space (RIS) has Systems Engineering Internship opportunities for current college Junior, Senior and Post Graduate students to join and expand our Systems Engineering and Integration Team located in Indianapolis, Indiana. As a Systems Engineering Intern, you will work with a team of skilled and experienced engineers in performing many core activities to include design, development or test at the system, subsystem, and component level. The selected candidates will apply technical standards, principles, theories, concepts and techniques to resolve customer needs by providing customized engineering services and products for unique customer missions.
Our nationwide college recruiting program offers students from a variety of colleges and universities assignments that help you realize your career goals. Work with the best! From a world-class customer profile, to the work being done at the ends of earth, Raytheon Technologies offers a wealth of opportunities for your future and beyond. Our internship opportunities range from 10-16 week assignments and may include mentoring, special projects, and end of assignment presentations. Work with other interns and learn from our team of experienced professionals.

Responsibilities Include:
  • Providing basic support developing and documenting requirements and interfaces, design analysis, modeling and simulation, system integration and trade studies
  • Providing basic support developing, documenting and executing system verification to show compliance
  • Applying your engineering knowledge and participating as a member of a multi-discipline team
  • Contributing to the completion of project/program milestones under the general guidance of the immediate supervisor and team leads
  • Following established SE processes and procedures

Requirements:
  • Positive attitude and demonstrated leadership skills
  • Customer focus and ability to collaborate
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Completed Systems, Electrical, Software, Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering course work such as: Basic circuits, advanced circuits, circuits labs, electro-mechanical, digital theory, thermal theory, thermal labs, computer engineering, software languages, etc. of computers and computer systems
  • This position requires the ability to access systems that contain information restricted to US Citizens based on certain Federal Government contractual requirements.

Desired Requirements:
  • Knowledge of MS Office or other presentation tools
  • Previous Engineering project and/or internship experience
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • A cumulative GPA of 3.0+ is strongly desired (Please upload an unofficial transcript when applying)

Education Requirements:
  • Candidate must be enrolled in an accredited college or university, pursing a technical degree in Engineering (Aeronautical, Computer Engineering, Electrical, Mechanical, Software or Systems), Computer Science or a closely related STEM field.
  • Please include your transcript with your resume.
  • This position can be for a Junior, Senior or Post Graduate based on the candidate's qualifications, including degree credits earned.
    • ST03 (TechStudent-Junior) Junior status – must have completed 60-89 hours of college credits towards degree and obtained Junior status as of Summer 2021.
    • ST04 (TechStudent-Senior) Senior status – must have completed 90+ hours of college credits towards degree and obtained Senior status as of Summer 2021.
    • ST05 (TechStudent-PostGraduate) Post Graduate status - must be currently pursuing a Master's or PhD degree and obtained Post Graduate status as of Summer 2021.

This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 169105

Raytheon Technologies is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

SAFETY FOCUS

You can experience the excitement of our company – it's the difference between taking a job and starting a career.

This is not work experience, this is an opportunity to experience work.

An Intern is an investment in Moog’s future. The intern relationship provides a three-way benefit between the student, university, and Moog. It is an opportunity for the student to incorporate classroom learning into professional, real world situations. The student brings new ideas to Moog on how to tackle projects and challenges, while Moog benefits from fresh perspectives from the brightest students in their respective fields of study. By having the students work on actual programs, we also work towards solving our customers’ most difficult technical challenges.

Moog’s Space & Defense and Industrial Groups, in Blacksburg, VA 24060 are seeking students for internships and/or Co-Ops in the areas of engineering!

As part of the Moog U.S. Internship Program, this position provides strategic and tactical support to senior and mid-level employees. Engineering work can include (but is not limited to) Design, Electrical, Mechanical, Product, Software, Systems, and/or Test Equipment.
As a Moog Intern you will contribute to routine engineering work requiring the application of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria in carrying out a variety of engineering tasks. You will also have the opportunity to work on discipline-focused projects and tasks to enhance your collegiate learning experience, while providing meaningful contributions to the Moog Engineering Team(s).

Responsibilities
  • Contribute to the preparation and execution of key engineering projects at Moog.
  • Provide input on project processes, strategies, and execution.
  • Operate as a multidisciplinary member of the team of creative, independent individuals.
  • Represent Moog in a manner consistent with its technical and professional reputation.
  • Provide technical support to engineers, as needed.
  • Work experience may include conceptual design, detail design, testing, stress analyses, metallurgical laboratory work, and/or project engineering, based on the student's educational discipline.

Basic Requirements
  • Active enrolment in Bachelor's or Master's Degree curriculum in Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial, Aerospace, Computer or Computer Science Engineering at an accredited university.
  • Currently a 3rd year student or higher is strongly preferred and may be required in some areas.
  • GPA of 3.0, or greater, in most areas. Exact GPA requirement will be determined by department specification.
  • Multiple blocks preferred
  • United States Citizenship, or the legal ability to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship.
Students within the Moog U.S. Internship Program are expected to have a professional disposition, with effective communication skills, a strong desire to learn, a positive attitude, and the ability to work in a team environment.

position: SoC & AI for Access BL Summer Intern
description:
About Nokia

At Nokia we create the technology to connect the world. Developing and delivering the industry's only end-to-end portfolio of network equipment, software, services and licensing that is available globally. Through our research teams, including the world-renowned Nokia Bell Labs, Nokia is leading the world to adopt end-to-end 5G networks that are faster, more secure and capable of revolutionizing lives, economies and societies. Nokia adheres to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. A truly global company, we are 160 nationalities working in more than 100 countries.

About Nokia Bell Labs

Do you want to change the world?
Do you want to invent the future?
Are you looking for meaningful real-world experience?

Then Nokia Bell Labs, the Nobel Prize winning research organization, is for you. We are currently accepting applications for our intern program.

Nokia Bell Labs is building the future – connecting all humans, all senses, all things, all systems, all infrastructure, all processes. Discovering the possibilities that shape the human experience are at the heart of everything we do. Our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with industry leading experts, and the best and brightest minds, who solve the most formidable challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.
Projects for the 2021 internship cover technologies such as 5G&6G, augmented intelligence, smart devices, IoT, data analytics, robotics, AI, cloud technologies and more…
As well as providing hands-on educational and collaborative experiences for a pool of talented and highly motivated students, our internship program will expand your field of study by exposing you to an unparalleled diversity of people, expertise and perspectives. In classic Bell Labs style, you will leave changed forever by an experience that will redefine your future.

Job Description
The Access Networks and Devices Laboratory of Nokia Bell Labs in Murray Hill, NJ, conducts research on high-speed wireless and wireline access communication technologies. We focus on next generation communication technologies, as well as artificial intelligence / machine learning techniques for Access Networks. Our research areas include design and develop high-performance hardware architectures and ASIC that accelerate signal processing, software defined networks, and artificial intelligence for communication.
Job Responsibilities & Competencies
  • Summer interns will work with seasoned Bell Labs researchers to conduct algorithmic design.
  • Simulation study and/or proof-of-concept prototypes development may follow.
  • Knowledge in System-on-Chip, advanced digital/analog circuits for computing, computer architecture, artificial intelligence / machine learning and/or digital signal processing is preferred.
  • Experience in relevant CAD tool is desirable.
  • Candidates with strong analytic skills, and hands-on development skills are encouraged to apply.

Qualifications
  • experience in digital hardware design (FPGA and ASIC); and/or
  • experience in embedded software development, DSP or GPU programming
  • Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above
  • Must be enrolled as a full-time student
  • Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements or may consider sponsoring short-term J1 Visa PhD students dependent upon program requirements.
  • PhD student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Systems Engineering or Telecommunications. Highly qualified MS students will also be considered.
Imagine creating technology that has the potential to change the world. Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people’s lives and help to overcome some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves. Come create the technology to connect the world.

Seeking undergraduate and graduate college students for Vulnerability Research (VR) and Software Development internships for spring and summer 2021 at Raytheon Cyber Offense & Defense Experts (CODEX) in Austin,TX. CODEX’s passion is work that challenges, engages, and empowers real-world mission impact which means our research and development efforts cover the full spectrum of security technologies for computer network operations. Candidates must play both sides of the fence—developing and defeating advanced new security techniques. Projects are undertaken on small teams in close coordination with customers to quickly deliver or enhance capabilities.

The most capable will have a variety of low-level operating systems experience and cross-platform vulnerability research. If you've discovered a kernel paged pool exploit, modified JIT engines to add your own instrumentation to mitigate entire vulnerability classes, created a heap-based buffer overflow with ASLR/DEP defeats, used solvers to highlight interesting call/dataflow graphs, or created custom hardware emulators… you'll be right at home in CODEX.

Required Skills:

  • Proficiency in one or more scripting languages (e.g. Python, Ruby, Bash, Powershell)
  • Proficiency in one or more systems programming languages (e.g. C/C++)
  • Familiarity with low-level architectures (e.g. x86, ARM)

Desired Skills:
  • Computer network operations experience (e.g. CTFs, red/blue teams, pentesting)
  • Networked communications development (e.g. TCP/UDP sockets, Bluetooth, GSM)
  • Reverse engineering experience (e.g. IDA Pro, WinDbg, ollydbg, gdb, objdump)
  • Hardware emulation development (e.g. QEMU, Unicorn, Panda, VHDL)
  • Cryptographic experience (e.g. implementing AES, side channel attacks)
  • Mobile/embedded development (e.g. Android, iOS, Raspberry Pi)
  • Active U.S. Government Security Clearance


Security Clearance:
Qualified applicants will be subject to a security investigation and must meet the requirements to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI government security clearance. Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.

Education Requirements:
Candidate must be enrolled in an accredited college or university, pursuing a technical degree in the area of Cyber, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineering or related field. A GPA of 3.0+ is strongly desired. Please include your transcript with your resume.

Job Title: Intern, Software Test Engineer

Applies To: Engineering

FLSA Classification: Non-Exempt

Reports To: Senior Manager, QA and Test Automation

Department: Engineering

Primary Location: Oak Brook, IL

Job Summary and Scope of Responsibility:
At CGI you’re going to learn fast.

You will learn about the industry standards, best practices, and modern tools in software testing while helping to ship code to our users. You’re going to be challenged and you’re going to get the hands-on experience you need for a long, successful career.

Culture

At CGI, our people make our organization. We value the skills, strengths and perspectives of our diverse team. We strive to create an environment where employees can flourish and succeed. We stand for excellence—but also for each other. We stand strong…because we stand together. Our cultural attributes describe how we live our Values. At CGI that means being One Team, Effective, Passionate, Accountable and Creative.

Oak Brook Headquarters

CGI's headquarters is a 4-story, state-of-the-art new building in Oak Brook, Illinois. Designed for natural light and surrounded by a 3/4-mile walking path, CGI HQ was designed for better health, better collaboration and better performance.

Career Development Intern Opportunities

CGI’s Career Development Intern Opportunities are designed to give college students hands-on experience in software engineering to complement their formal education.

In an effort to accomplish this, students must:
  • Utilize learning opportunities such as training, meetings, or conferences offered by Chamberlain Group
  • Complete work assignments in a thorough, consistent, and punctual manner
  • Assume personal and professional responsibility for his/her actions and activities
  • Maintain professional relationships with Chamberlain Group’s employees, clients, and customers, both internal and external
  • Develop a self-awareness of attitudes, values, and behavior patterns that positively influence the work environment
  • Handle confidential information in a professional and ethical manner
  • Adhere to Chamberlain Group’s policies and procedures
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
The Software Test Co-Op will contribute to the software release quality by applying manual and automated testing techniques.

  • Learn and apply the fundamental concepts of manual and automated software testing, using Java, Selenium or Appium, SoapUI
  • Learn about Chamberlain Group’s cloud platform and connected devices
  • Learn to operate in an Agile team setting by being part of a scrum team and participating in daily scrum, sprint planning, and retrospectives
  • Contribute to testing new features by analyzing requirements and creating test cases
  • Participate in regression testing by executing test cases, recording test results in TestRail
  • Report software defects in JIRA and present them to the team in daily stand-up
  • Participate in smoke testing during code deployments
  • Document software defects and report your findings to the team
  • Comply with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library
  • Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential
Minimum Qualifications

Education/Certifications:
  • Rising Senior standing towards a Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, or computer science strongly preferred
  • Must be committed to the duration of the Fall Co-Op Program Semester (Sept – Dec 2020)
  • Must possess an unrestricted right to work in the United States
  • Must be local during Summer season as it will require to work at the Oak Brook office
  • GPA minimum: 3.5 on a 4.0 point scale
Experience:
  • Demonstrated experience in OOP programming in Java/C#
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Effective communication skills
  • Willingness to learn quickly and ask questions
Preferred Qualifications

Education/Certifications:
Experience:
  • Intern or co-op experience
  • Demonstrated experience in software testing
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Proficient with MS Office tools
  • Self-driven, organized, goal oriented individual with positive attitude
Chamberlain is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.

Corning’s summer internship experience is rich with hands-on learning. You’ll live, work, and experience the communities in which Corning operates, while building on-the-job skills.

Our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with industry leading experts, and the best and brightest minds, who solve the most formidable challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.
Projects for the 2021 internship cover technologies such as 5G&6G, augmented intelligence, smart devices, IoT, data analytics, robotics, AI, cloud technologies and more…
As well as providing hands-on educational and collaborative experiences for a pool of talented and highly motivated students, our internship program will expand your field of study by exposing you to an unparalleled diversity of people, expertise and perspectives. In classic Bell Labs style, you will leave changed forever by an experience that will redefine your future.

Job Description
Internship position in Networking at Nokia Bell Labs. Involves Research & Development with Bell Labs Mentors during Summer 2021.

Job Responsibilities & Competencies

Project include topics in:
  • Software Defined Networking, Network Function Acceleration.
  • Infrastructure for Internet of Things, Edge Computing, Augmented Reality.
  • Blockchains and their uses in Networking.
  • Network Attack Detection and Mitigation, Network Application Fingerprinting and other areas of Network Security.
  • Network Algorithms and Analytics.
  • Network Resource Allocation and Performance Optimization using ML tools.

Qualifications
  • Must be pursuing a doctoral degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science from an accredited college/university

  • Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above

  • Must be enrolled as a full-time student.

  • Strong background in areas of Networking and applications of Machine Learning, Algorithms to Networking.
  • Experience in building network systems and/or designing network algorithms.

  • Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements or may consider sponsoring short-term J1 Visa PhD students dependent upon program requirements.


Imagine creating technology that has the potential to change the world. Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people’s lives and help to overcome some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves. Come create the technology to connect the world

position: National Consulting - Tysons - Consultant Development Program - Technology Consulting - Platforms Intern - Summer 2021
description:
When you join our Technology Consulting practice as an intern, you're a part of our Consultant Development Program (CDP). Each individual experience will vary but through this program you'll be provided learning opportunities, technical competency training, and coaching to develop core consulting skills.

What to expect
At EY Consulting, we are building a better working world by transforming businesses through the power of people, technology and innovation. The advent of emerging tech is recasting all industries and requires our clients to embrace turning new technology capabilities into new competitive advantages. As a Technology Consultant you will help our clients actualize the potential of technology to improve processes and drive innovation through Digital and Emerging Technologies, Data & Analytics, Technology Solutions Delivery, and Technology Transformation.

Within Technology Consulting there are several opportunities within industry sectors; you can select your preference in our collect form, linked above.

Financial Services Organization (FSO):
  • As a Financial Services Technology Consulting intern, you will focus exclusively in financial services and will have the opportunity to serve leading investment banks, retail and commercial banks, insurers and investment managers.
  • Technology Consulting interns within FSO will have diversified experiences across clients and technology competencies. Once you have developed a strong foundation, we will work with you to determine a more specific area of concentration for the next phase of your career journey.
  • For those looking to have a specific area of concentration from the outset there is the opportunity to align to a Data & Analytics or Platform Implementation track.

National Consulting:
  • The National Consulting practice serves clients across a variety of industries including, but not limited to: Advanced Manufacturing & Mobility, Power & Utilities, Health Sciences & Wellness, Consumer, and Technology, Media & Entertainment, Telecommunications.
  • Technology Consulting interns within National Consulting will be aligned to one of the following tracks: Platforms, Data & Analytics, and Engineering.
Government & Public Sector (GPS):
  • As an intern with the Government & Public Sector practice, you’ll have the opportunity to work with federal clients, as well as state and local agencies and higher education institutions.
  • Technology consulting interns within GPS will be aligned to one of the following tracks: Technology Consulting or Data & Analytics.
Your key responsibilities may include:
  • Helping clients drive business-led and technology-enabled transformation across a broad range of business issues
  • Understanding and documenting clients’ business processes and requirements, performing root cause analyses, developing business cases, and gathering information
  • Taking full responsibility for tasks including consistent self-review of work to identify and improve an approach for producing high quality work products, while working under supervision
  • Growing lasting relationships with our clients, understanding their needs, and consistently delivering quality client services
  • Monitoring progress, managing risks and ensuring key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes
  • Developing specific technology skills relevant to engagement and project work
  • Continuously updating your understanding of current business and industry trends

To qualify for the role you must have:
  • Obtained or progress toward a bachelor’s degree in a relevant technology discipline, i.e. Computer Science, Computer or other technology-related Engineering, Information Systems, Information Technology, Statistics, Math, MIS
  • Desire to work in consulting demonstrated by relevant course work, interest or internship experience
  • Willingness and ability to learn and work independently with minimal supervision
  • Demonstrated project management, teaming, organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
  • Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to project deadlines
  • Integrity within a professional environment
  • The flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours when necessary
  • The understanding that when it is safe to do so, travel is an essential function of the job, may vary by location and can be up to 80%
  • Proficiency with MS Office, including MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint
  • A driver’s license valid in the U.S.
  • Candidates interested in the Government & Public Sector industry focus must have sole U.S. citizenship and be able to obtain and maintain a secret clearance or higher, within the designated timeframe, which will be determined by the engagement requirements for a security clearance
In addition to the above qualifications we are seeking candidates with an aptitude, interest, and/or experience in any of the following:
  • Development skills such as Java, Javascript, .Net, Python, C, C++, PHP, IoT development, or web development
  • Analytics focused tools and platforms including, but not limited to, SQL, R, Tableau, Power BI, and Spotfire
  • Business process design, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software, such as SAP or Oracle, or integration tools
What working at EY offers
We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.
Plus, we offer:
  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
  • Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams
About EY
As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark. Apply today

position: CAMPUS: Environmental Data Analyst Cooperative Education or Internship Opportunity - Fall/Spring
company: Langan Engineering and Environmental Services, Inc.
description:
Work for an Industry Leader
Challenging Projects & Dynamic Work Environment
Extensive Training Program
Community Service Opportunities

Langan is an award-winning ENR Top 500 Design Firm that offers integrated engineering and environmental services for both public and private sector clients at sites located throughout the United States and abroad. Langan receives numerous recognitions for its technical expertise as well as its work environment, including “Best Places to Work” by NJBIZ, Zweig Group’s “Hot Firm” and ranked “Best Firm to Work For” in four categories, “Best Places to Work in Pennsylvania” by Best Companies Group and Pittsburgh Business Times “Best Places to Work in Western PA”, “Top Engineering Firm” by both San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal. Visit our website for more information about our awards and recognitions.

Langan has an outstanding Fall and Spring (October 2020 - May 2021) Environmental Data Analyst Cooperative Education or Internship opportunity in our Parsippany, NJ office. The successful candidate will assist with reduction, analysis and reporting of data using databases and various data management techniques. This is a unique opportunity to apply data management and visualization tools in real-world applications and to enhance skill sets. The position will involve working with the following software: Esri's GIS, EarthSoft's EQulS, Microsoft Excel and Access.

Job Requirements :

  • Bachelor’s degree in Science, Engineering or Information Technology;
  • Experience using Microsoft Excel to manipulate and organize data sets for import into a database and for final reporting;
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal;
  • Strong attention to detail with excellent analytical and judgment capabilities; and
  • Ability to effectively work independently and in a team environment.

Please submit resume, cover letter and include unofficial academic transcripts. Preference will be given to students who are currently in their Jr. or Sr. year or to students pursuing their MS degree.

Langan does not provide housing nor relocation assistance for internship/co-op positions.

Langan offers its interns and co-ops opportunities that provide challenge and responsibility within an environment where they can grow and flourish!

Company: Corning

Corning’s summer internship experience is rich with hands-on learning. You’ll live, work, and experience the communities in which Corning operates, while building on-the-job skills.

Shape your future; apply today!

  • Duration: Summer 2021, 8-12 weeks

Responsibilities:

  • Problem-solving skills
  • Organizational skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively present information
  • Results-oriented
  • Flexibility - Able to change and adjust smoothly as the situation demands

This position does not support immigration sponsorship.

Inovalon is seeking undergraduate college junior and senior students with diverse academic backgrounds to join our Summer Internship Program this year. position: Precision Solutions Product Validation Field Test Engineer Intern
description:
Overview:
Through its people and brands, CNH Industrial delivers power, technology and innovation to farmers, builders and drivers all around the world. Each of its brands, including Case IH, New Holland Agriculture, Case and New Holland Construction, FPT Industrial, Capital, and Parts & Service, is a major international force in its specific sector. The Precision Solutions Product Validation Field Test Engineer will experience in full life cycle of SW design process and life cycle; Hands-on experience in dynamic complex HW/SW testing environment. This intern will also be apart of development of test plans, test cases, and methodology in a production environment, as well as, troubleshooting CAN-based vehicle electronic systems.
Responsibilities:
  • Develop and/or maintain detailed system and sub-system test procedures for functional, performance, and safety tests as related to Precision Farming, Product Control, and Guidance content based on system specifications.
  • Execute validation plan and test procedures on the bench or in-field testing at CNH Industrial test facilities or external customer sites.
  • Document and clearly communicate test results, including issue reporting into proper tracking tools. Maintain and update issues as they are resolved.
  • Assist in root cause analysis and validation of resolution for problems identified during field testing. Collect and analyze data to assist development team in root cause identification and problem resolution.
  • Submit timely and concise reports covering system performance.
  • Aid design team in vehicle tuning exercises or targeted development tests for Auto Guidance and Precision Farming features of the PS&T software.
Qualifications:
  • Pursuing Bachelor’s Degree in Agricultural, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, computer science or EET or related degree area.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Farm Equipment, Precision Farming systems or connected vehicle systems.
  • Experience in electronic troubleshooting and diagnostics or a related field. Complex mechanical assembly service or troubleshooting acceptable too.
  • Experience with development and execution of test plans.
  • Ability to demonstrate good written and verbal communication skills required.
  • Ability to demonstrate good computer skills with Word, Excel, MSOffice suite.
  • Ability to work independently with little supervision.
  • Closed loop control system appreciation and understanding – electro-hydraulic, electrical and electronic systems.
  • Mechanical aptitude and appreciation, to supplement, if SW and/or Electrical background
  • Communications protocol experience and understanding (e.g. Serial, CAN, Cellular, Wifi, GPS, ISOBUS).
  • Agricultural, construction, or similar background which demonstrates familiarity with operation of off-highway equipment.
  • Experience using Vector tools, or other tools for serial bus system data logging and analysis.
EEO:
CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here.

If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call 1-800-889-4422 option 1 and then option 5, or contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.

Under the direction of the Software Developer – IT Co-op Manager, the Information Technology Co-Op will work on projects designing and developing application programs, quality assurance testing, or network administration to provide business solutions for The Rawlings Group. This is an exciting opportunity to work on real projects and tasks in a full service information technology department.


About Us

The Rawlings Group provides payment integrity services and claims data analysis for health insurance carriers and their members. We work behind the scenes to make sure that members are receiving the full value of their coverage and that providers recover when a claim is paid in error. Providing payment integrity and recovery services to the industry creates a more equitable distribution of healthcare dollars so members can receive the care they need when they need it most.

Our employees are the backbone of our organization. We offer opportunities for growth and development, continuing education, internal mobility and promotions, and unrivaled income earning potential. We are looking for individuals that have the drive and commitment to make a difference in the industry. We invite you to apply to become a part of the Rawlings Group team.

Our Culture is focused on:

  • The guiding principle of doing the right thing
  • Caring for our employees and taking pride in the work they do
  • Providing recognition and financially rewarding employees for their success

Our Values are:

  • Integrity and Trust
  • Customer Service Excellence
  • Innovation
  • Diversity and Inclusion
  • Honoring our Veterans and their service


Responsibilities

  • Work with customers and manager to understand requirements for simple to complex business systems
  • Work with IT staff to develop technical specifications based upon functional specifications as created
  • Analyze and perform modifications to systems as requested by manager or customers
  • Analyze and assist in correction of problems which may occur in system operations


  • Must be working toward a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or closely related field
  • Design and development using Microsoft Visual Studio, C#, .Net and SQL
  • Ability to work well in an application development team and with internal customers


Physical Requirements

  • Frequently remains in sitting position for long periods of time to perform duties
  • Frequently concentrates for long periods of time, paying close attention to detail
  • Frequently uses and views the computer using fingers, hands, and vision
  • Frequently works in a well-lit, tempered environment
  • Occasionally walks through office to communicate with other employees


  • Equal Employment Opportunity. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or veteran status, except where age, sex, or physical status is a bona fide occupational qualification.
  • The Rawlings Group is an employment at will employer.


#LI-JS23

Greetings Applicant!

Here at Parsec Education we are opening up our doors to find creative, driven individuals who are looking to make an impact and have the opportunity to help shape a fast-growing company. We are working hard to bring a new day of modern design and technology into the world of public education, and we are seeking team members who have a passion for equipping and empowering educators to make data-driven decisions. When data, resources, and manpower all align, we can help build a brighter future for education.
*
Parsec Education is an educational data analytics company headquartered in Fresno, California. Parsec Education specializes in analyzing state and local-level data and applying industry-leading data visualization and user-interface and experience design (UI/UX) methods to build custom, actionable tools. Parsec Education works collaboratively with state, county, and local agencies to address the most pressing needs of publicly funded schools in California.
*
*
Data Science Internship

Part-Time Internship Position: 20 hours per week

Hourly Rate: $17-$22 per hour

Application Deadline: Until Filled

To apply, submit your application, and required documents online.

Job Summary

Parsec Education is seeking a Data Scientist Intern. The intern would work alongside our lead data scientist to learn from, and support, new and existing projects. Typical data scientist workflow consists of data acquisition, preparation, analysis, modeling, visualization, and deployment & maintenance of reporting tools. The ultimate goal for the internship position would be to gain adequate competency in data science operations to help increase the company’s capacity.

Qualifications

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree or PhD in Data Science/Computer Science/Mathematics (or related field), and/or within 1 year of their post-graduation date.
  • Able to query data in SQL and build central repositories.
  • Able to apply user-interface and user-experience design principles.
  • Able to utilize business intelligence (BI) tools for analytics reporting.
  • Able to code in Python or other programming languages, and leverage open-source libraries for data science.
  • Knowledge of data science methods, for example, supervised and unsupervised machine learning and time-series forecasting.
  • Strong mathematical skills.
  • Highly motivated with outstanding verbal and written communication skills and be able to work with both technical and non-technical partners.

Other Qualifications

  • Great at solving problems; debugging; troubleshooting; and designing & implementing solutions to complex technical issues.
  • Thrive on teamwork.
  • Strong technical, analytical, and collaborative abilities.
  • A knack for driving impact and growth.
  • Openness to professional development by trying and acquiring new skills.
  • Strong work ethic, drive, and efficient workflow.

Environment

Work will be performed primarily in a standard office setting. Remote work option may be required due to Covid-19. If work-from-home is required, Parsec will provide the necessary equipment to carry out the duties of the position.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

It is the policy of Parsec Education to provide equal opportunity in all areas of employment practices and to assure that there shall be no discrimination against any person on the basis of sex, ancestry, age, marital status, race, religious creed, mental disability, medical condition (including HIV and AIDS), color, national origin, physical disability, family or sexual preference status and other similar factors in compliance with Title IX, Sections 503 and 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, other federal and state non-discrimination regulations, and its own statements of philosophy of objectives.

  • 1. Resume
  • 2. Cover Letter
  • 3. References (3)

  • 8 hour shift

Overview

**This position is intended for students in a degree-seeking program, to which they will return at the end of the summer internship in 2021. If you do not meet this minimum criteria, please revisit our careers site for other opportunities.**
At Intuit, we want to invest in the next generation of tech entrepreneurs by bringing them into our organization early and encouraging them to bring their talents back to Intuit after they graduate. Our internship program is focused on identifying these high-potential university students and equipping them with the tools they need to succeed in the tech industry.

Through our summer internship program, university students gain the confidence to make meaningful work contributions that enable business growth with our products, customers, and internal processes.

  • BS or MS in Computer Science (or related degree)
  • Strong software engineering skills
  • Solid understanding of object oriented design and programming languages
  • Experience with at least one of the following: Java, C#, C++
  • Front-end web development skills preferred (D/HTML, JavaScript, XML, Flex, CSS)
  • Familiarity or the ability to learn current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, accessibility and usability

  • Technical Assessment
  • Values Fit
  • Research and summer work experience
  • Leadership positions in group activities

How you will lead

During Intuit's summer internship program, interns will interact with our senior leaders, learn directly from our business partners, and leverage our unique business practices all while taking on rigorous assignments. Our interns have opportunities to work in one of the following areas:
  • Software Engineer: Full Stack/Front-End/Back-End/Security/DevOps/Mobile

The Galactic Reddit Academy (aka Reddit's internship program) is ready for liftoff, and we need Software Engineering Interns to join our crew!

Are you a beginner Software Engineer with a dream of both coding and browsing r/catsstandingup at work? You're in the right place! Reddit is in search of Software Engineering Interns to join our next summer internship program!

Not familiar with Reddit? We're a community of nearly 430 million active users, with a mission of helping people of all shapes, sizes and backgrounds discover places where they can be their true selves.

At Reddit, you'll get to:

Work on projects that impact the business. You'll gain exposure to how a real engineering team works, from sprint planning to shipping code.

Be mentored by experienced engineers from all backgrounds. From Dev Bootcamp, Google, Hackbright Academy, Microsoft, and MIT, you'll work with engineers of many different experiences and levels. You'll have a formal mentor on your team guiding you throughout the summer as well!

Contribute to the betterment of Reddit, whether that be through making it easier to create content on Reddit, serving up relevant content to users, fighting evil on the site, improving our mobile apps, or a number of other projects we have in the works.

Come to work every day at our San Francisco office, complete with catered breakfast and lunch, free snacks, a rooftop terrace, and easy access to downtown San Francisco.

Continue making Reddit history as a part of our fourth intern class. Be a part of a new community, earn piles of sweet Reddit swag and get to know the city during sponsored outings over the course of the summer.

We're looking for interns across all of our engineering teams. If you fit the following criteria, we'd love to hear from you!:

  • A desire to work at Reddit HQ in San Francisco over Summer 2021( (Subject to change based on safety guidelines due to the pandemic)
  • Actively working towards a Bachelor's degree in CS or a related field
  • Graduating between December 2021 and Summer 2022
  • Able to program your way out of a paper bag
  • Authorization to work in the United States
  • You're over the age of 18

In lieu of a cover letter, please submit response to the following question:

  • If you could add any feature to Reddit, what would you add and why?

Join Reddit; help build the front page of the internet.

Description

Informatica is currently seeking an enthusiastic and motivated Intern to join our Redwood city, California team. This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of experienced, innovative and energetic team on a rapid, agile development schedule. The Intern will participate in the Cloud DevOps activities which primarily include implementation of continuous integration, continuous deployment and infrastructure as a code.

Job Summary

As a Cloud DevOps intern, you will be responsible for continuous integration, continuous deployment and infrastructure as code of cloud products where you will participate in automating the complete CI/CD process and DevOps provisioning for cloud products and interfaces in great technical depth to increase productivity and efficiency. You will play a key role in on-time product delivery with high quality and drive customer success. In the role of Cloud DevOps Intern you must be able to work and adapt in a fluid, fast-paced environment.

Technology You’ll Use:

  • Docker and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), cloud log services (ELK, Sumo Logic, Splunk), cloud application monitoring tools (Elastic APM, AppDynamics, New Relic)
  • Jenkins and Spinnaker CI/CD tools
  • Perforce and Git version control systems.
  • Kubernetes, AWS EKS, Helm, Istio, Kiali, Service Mesh
  • Telemetry tools which include Prometheus, ELK, Sumo Logic, Jaeger
  • Web client technologies such as React and Java
  • Unit testing, Integration, and end to end Karate, Cypress and Selenium

What You’ll Do

  • You will work on cloud applications built on latest cutting-edge technology
  • You will be part of scrum teams and contribute to automated CI/CD process
  • Working with an agile team to setup and configure cloud-based environments.
  • Actively participate in design meetings with the development team.
  • Package and support deployment of releases.
  • Adhering to high-quality development principles while delivering solutions on-time and on budget.

Key Essentials

  • You are a team player who strives for excellence.
  • You are comfortable working both independently and collaboratively.
  • Your problem-solving skills and technical aptitudes allow you to adapt to new circumstances and learn quickly when facing new problems and challenges.
  • You are comfortable to work with a wide range of software, including development tools, build systems, and software deployment tools.
  • You have a keen interest in software technologies.
  • Creative and analytical approach problem solving skills
  • Strong oral and written communication are necessary for success
  • Experience with multiple programming languages is a benefit but there is also room to improve your skills.
  • Most entry-level engineers have a level of proficiency in: Java and/or Python
  • Some experience working with and implementing DevOps solutions including but not limited to Python, Ansible, Docker/Containers, Kubernetes and Kubernetes deployments.
  • Minimum Requirements Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline
  • Student in the field of Software Engineering/Computer Science/Engineering/Exact sciences from a leading university.
  • Minimum 3 semesters left for graduation/graduated

Nice to Have

  • Projects, experiences, or coursework related to areas such as: Operating Systems, Computer Architecture, Multi-Threading, Data Structures & Algorithms, Software Quality and Automation, CI/CD Automation, cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
  • Strong Advantage – Proven experience in CI/CD or Cloud DevOps
  • Advantage - Proven scripting/coding capabilities.
  • Advantage - Good knowledge of LINUX.
  • Advantage - Familiar with Cloud providers and services: AWS, AZURE

City: Redwood City

State: California

Network Programmability Technical Marketing Engineers use software development to enhance the automation capabilities of our products, while being empowered to help drive the technology to innovative directions. Their work includes active involvement between R&D and Product Management groups, creation of demonstrations and technical content for partners and customers, and developing automation to help drive the Aruba Software Defined Network architecture.

About Us:

Dimagi was born from the belief that there's a better way to provide services to those in need. Our mission is to create digital products that support global development efforts and help accelerate the end of extreme poverty. CommCare, our mobile data collection platform, is designed to improve data collection and the quality of frontline services in low-resource settings around the world. We work across various sectors with organizations of all sizes providing mobile solutions that put end-users first. Working with partners that include the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, USAID, CARE International, and the World Bank, Dimagi has successfully implemented CommCare and supported 2,000 projects across 80 countries. Dimagi is a certified Benefit Corporation and leading social enterprise, working since 2002 towards our commitment to making an impact.

About the Position:

Dimagi is looking for an Applications Engineer Intern to join our Solutions Division. This position will be supporting our most technical implementations. Focused on building capacity, you will work on activities that enable our client-facing teams to be efficient and well-informed on technical matters.

This position will be based out of our Cambridge office but is also open to remote work within the United States. This role can start of as a fall internship with the option to continue into the spring semester. This position will be working with our team in South Africa, so there is a requirement to be able to work some South African time business hours.

We work on a broad range of international development issues, including strengthening community health programs, electronic medical records, care coordination, and remote data collection. We have projects in over 50 countries, including Zambia, Tanzania, Uganda, South Africa, Ethiopia, India, Bangladesh, Senegal, Mexico, Nigeria, Nicaragua, Kenya, Afghanistan, and the United States.

At Dimagi, you will have the opportunity to grow your skillset as well as make a real impact across the world. Do you like deep diving into technical topics and explaining it in an easy-to-understand manner? Then this role is for you!

Required skills and qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or working towards a Bachelors Degree in computer science, engineering or an equivalent technical field
  • Aptitude and self-direction to quickly learn new technical systems
  • Familiarity with debugging
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Familiarity with seeking out, and interpreting unfamiliar technical components (configuration files, Http response, etc.) to identify and address problems
  • Reliable, self-directed, and resourceful
  • Eligible to work in the United States

position: Mirror X Bell Labs Summer Intern
description:
About Nokia

At Nokia we create the technology to connect the world. Developing and delivering the industry's only end-to-end portfolio of network equipment, software, services and licensing that is available globally. Through our research teams, including the world-renowned Nokia Bell Labs, Nokia is leading the world to adopt end-to-end 5G networks that are faster, more secure and capable of revolutionizing lives, economies and societies. Nokia adheres to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. A truly global company, we are 160 nationalities working in more than 100 countries.

About Nokia Bell Labs

Do you want to change the world?
Do you want to invent the future?
Are you looking for meaningful real-world experience?

Then Nokia Bell Labs, the Nobel Prize winning research organization, is for you. We are currently accepting applications for our intern program.

Nokia Bell Labs is building the future – connecting all humans, all senses, all things, all systems, all infrastructure, all processes. Discovering the possibilities that shape the human experience are at the heart of everything we do. Our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with industry leading experts, and the best and brightest minds, who solve the most formidable challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.
Projects for the 2021 internship cover technologies such as 5G&6G, augmented intelligence, smart devices, IoT, data analytics, robotics, AI, cloud technologies and more…
As well as providing hands-on educational and collaborative experiences for a pool of talented and highly motivated students, our internship program will expand your field of study by exposing you to an unparalleled diversity of people, expertise and perspectives. In classic Bell Labs style, you will leave changed forever by an experience that will redefine your future.

Job Description

Markus Weldon introduced the term Mirror X at the Web Summit in 2019. Robots, mixed reality devices, infrastructure and other sensors will provide the proximal sensing necessary to create a Mirror World/Digital Twin of the Physical world - in real time. Such a digital twin will be a key element in the digitalization of enterprises. It allows to simulate various aspects of an enterprise, to optimize processes, to evaluate the outcome of actions before applying it to the physical world, etc.

In practice, we must rely on incomplete and noisy sensor information to build the digital twin. In this internship we will select a high value use case that is enabled by Mirror X. This Summer 2021 you will create a showcase in our experimental setup that builds a useful high value service despite these imperfections.



Job Responsibilities & Competencies
  • Get familiar with the Mirror X concept
  • Select and develop the high value use case together with the Enterprise and Industrial Automation team in Nokia Bell Labs.
  • Create an implementation plan to showcase the Mirror X use case.
  • Work with the Nokia Bell Labs team to implement the showcase.
  • Demonstrate the Mirror X showcase to stakeholders in Nokia

Qualifications


  • Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above.
  • Must be enrolled as a full-time student.
  • U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements or may consider sponsoring short-term J1 Visa PhD students dependent upon program requirements.
  • Must be pursuing a degree in Biochemistry, Biomedical Engineering, Biophysics, Business Modeling, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Microbiology, Nanotechnology, Operations Research, Physics, Statistics, Systems Engineering and Telecommunications from an accredited college/university.
  • Strong programming skills in C++ or Python.
  • Strong signal processing skills.
  • Track record of innovation and creation of a compelling user experience

Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves. Come create the technology to connect the world.

The system has enough variety to challenge and interest anyone an information-dense user interface, a high-throughput, low latency parallel computational core, service-oriented architecture, and interfaces to exchanges' market data and execution systems.

ABOUT SICK:

SICK is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of sensors, safety systems, and automatic identification products for industrial applications. Whether automating factories or optimizing distribution centers, SICK provides cost-effective solutions. We have been a technology leader for more than 70 years and with more than 50 global subsidiaries, SICK has a presence all over the world. Leveraging a history of innovation, our company has pioneered a long line of industry firsts‑such as the first safety light curtain, the first color sensor, and many more.

POSITION SUMMARY:

An intern at SICK is involved in the day to day activities within the business through immersion into different projects. The intern will have the opportunity to work within a team to gain knowledge and first-hand experience of what a career in this industry would be like. As a Software Engineer Co-op/ Intern at SICK, you would have the opportunity to create exciting applications on multiple platforms that extends our current software suite’s capabilities as well as future products. This role would help the qualified candidate understand the various software and hardware products that SICK offers and dive deep into how specific business needs are met using these products.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Under supervision, understand software requirements to design and develop applications in both Windows and Linux platforms
  • Work closely with Senior members to understand business logic and domain knowledge of current software platforms
  • Provide progress updates to Supervisor in a timely manner
  • Provide assistance as required to other senior members of the team in the areas of specific implementation of code, preparing software for testing phases and documentation
  • Work on a chosen project with the assistance of the manager, mentor, and team.
  • Work closely with the manager and a selected mentor to understand systems, processes, and key information.
  • Actively seek out information to learn how SICK operates as a business (products, departments, etc.).
  • Interface with other departments and interns to gain knowledge of the business, products, positions and more.
  • Provide innovative recommendations on how SICK can improve.
  • Complete a final presentation at the close of the internship that outlines the involved project(s) and knowledge gained.
  • Provide feedback on the internship experience at the close of the internship.
  • Carry out other duties and responsibilities as may be assigned or required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

  • Must be enrolled in an accredited university/college program pursuing a degree in Computer Science
  • Experience in object-oriented programming languages such as Java, knowledge of JavaScript is desirable
  • Understanding of Relational Databases and NoSQL is desired
  • Exposure to both Windows and Linux operating systems is desired
  • Exposure to scripting languages such as Bash, PHP, Python or Perl would be a plus
  • Hard working, pays attention to detail
  • Works well within a team and individually as well
  • Experience with Visio
  • Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-directed and able to work without supervision
  • Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas

Other Qualifications:

  • Ability to self-start and learn on the fly.
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint) and Internet applications.
  • Legally permitted to work in the United States.
  • Ability to work in a general office environment.

CORE COMPETENCIES:

Ethics and Integrity Personal Growth and Learning, Customer Focus, Personal Accountable, Building Effective Relationships

POSITIONAL COMPETENCIES:

Technical Learning, Problem solving, Drive for Results, Organizing, Personal Accountability

Company Description

Job Description

The Customer Success team helps to accelerate the development of innovative and effective security solutions designed to protect customers most valuable assets with our engineering, intelligence, services and consulting teams unified under a single banner. This tightly coordinated collaboration brings unmatched insights from the frontlines directly into customer defenses.

The Cyber Security Specialist will partner with the security team, program, and government customers to perform as an Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) for Special Access Programs located at the LM Sunnyvale facility in Sunnyvale, CA.

In this role you will:

  • Oversee day-to-day information system security operations including hardware and software implementations.

  • Auditing of the IS.
  • Upkeep, monitor, analyze, and respond to network and security events.

  • Ensure configuration management (CM) for security-relevant IS software, hardware, and firmware is maintained and documented in accordance with baseline.
  • Ensure all information system security-related documentation is current and accessible to properly authorized individuals.
  • Ensure records are maintained for workstations, software, servers, routers, firewalls, network switches, telephony equipment, etc. throughout the information system's life cycle.
  • Evaluate proposed changes or additions to the information system, and advise the ISSM of their security relevance.
  • Assist and conduct security IS education.
  • Participate in internal/external security audits/inspections; performs risk assessments.
  • Inform ISSM on technical IS security matters.
  • Ensure proper protection and / or corrective measures have been taken when an incident or vulnerability has been discovered.

description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. The Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) Research Team brings together a world-class team of researchers, developers, and engineers to create the future of AR and VR, which together will become as universal and essential as smartphones and personal computers are today. We are currently seeking innovative research interns with a passion for technology to develop next-generation head-mounted display and imaging systems. These roles are focused on developing advanced image synthesis methods for virtual and augmented reality systems. In particular we welcome PhD students in computer science, applied math, electrical engineering, or similar, with a strong background in deep learning, numerical optimization, computer graphics and computer vision. Our internships are sixteen (16) to twenty four (24) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.
  • Explore deep learning methods for image synthesis applications in virtual and augmented reality

Software Engineer Intern ( Fall 2020)

Date: Sep 29, 2020
Location: Newton, United States, Massachusetts, Newton
Job Category: R&D

About CyberArk:

CyberArk, the global leader in privileged access management, helps organizations transform their business through improved security and reduced risk. As a trusted partner for thousands of companies around the world, CyberArk consistently sets the bar – driving innovation and helping our customers stay one step ahead of attackers.


Job Description:

We are looking for software engineering interns to join the Conjur Community and Integrations (C&I) team at CyberArk this Fall! Our team delivers high-quality open source software and more to CyberArk’s customers. We know that our community is best served when:
  • Our projects are active, maintained, well organized, and superbly documented
  • We discuss, plan, design, and build in the open
  • Contributions from community members are solicited, welcomed, and reviewed

The intern will play an important role in helping us grow and maintain our suite of tools and integrations that work with Conjur open source. During the internship, the intern will work with the community and integrations team to extend our Conjur SDK from a handful of client libraries to a complete OpenAPI implementation. There will also be opportunities to write tutorials, blog posts, and provide code samples that community members can use to understand how to use our software. In creating this content, interns will get hands-on experience with bash, Docker, interacting with a REST API, and some of the most popular modern DevOps tools and platforms for deploying software.


Responsibilities
The Conjur C&I team are responsible for many features and initiatives within the CyberArk portfolio, including:
  • Features within the Conjur open source product
  • Integrations for the Conjur and DAP products with popular open DevOps tools
  • Connectors and enhancements for the revolutionary Secretless Broker
  • APIs and SDKs for the above

Requirements:

  • Senior currently enrolled in a University/ College
  • Major studies focused in Computer Science, Information System Security, etc or prior industry software development experience
  • Experience with Docker, Bash, Golang, Ruby is a plus
  • Capable of understanding the technical aspects of a complex system.
  • Must have excellent communication skills and a passion for providing world-class service.
  • Experience of directly supporting enterprise-level customers is a plus.
  • Ability and desire to learn products and technologies.
  • Must be able to work independently as well as with others, as part of a domestic and international team.
  • Excellent time management, decision making, prioritization and organization skills.
  • Experience developing on Unix/Linux based system is a plus

CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work in a team environment to develop real-world prototypes and applications that benefit the cybersecurity needs and challenges of the customer
  • Conducts cyber engineering research and provides technical assistance to the customer
  • Reviews engineering program activities to make recommendations for changes in cybersecurity policies and procedures
  • Utilize engineer drawings and white papers to operate related equipment, and provide technical assistance for improvements and system troubleshooting
  • Develop, test, review, debug, or deploy applications that support security protocols
  • Troubleshoot, research, and resolve security or risk issues with guidance

MINIMUM SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:

Actively pursuing a cyber engineering degree or cyber concentration in one of the following degree areas:

  • Computer Science
  • Computer Engineering
  • Software Engineering
  • Network Engineering
  • Electrical Engineering
  • Information Technology or Management Information Systems

DESIRED SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:

  • A variety of engineering tasks or projects dependent on area of study, experience, and expertise
  • Cyber Security related certifications: Network+, Security+, CISSP, CEH

THIS POSITION REQUIRES AN ACTIVE DoD SECRET CLEARANCE
