Our SaaS product, RelativityOne, has become the fastest-growing product in the company's history and we have consistently been named a great workplace. As we grow, we continue to seek individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.
We believe that great talent is not bound by geography and that what you do matters more than where you do it. Server Architecture
The Server Architecture Team is responsible for bridging the gap between the clients who use our cloud solution (RelativityOne) vs the local, on-premise installations. As ~85% of customers are using the on-prem solution, it is important to keep them up-to-date, while handling the latest RelativityOne changes. Joining the SAT means working on the latest technology that can ensure both solutions are able to progress seamlessly and efficiently together. In addition to being a member of this team that was formed earlier in the year, you would get to communicate with members of several other Relativity engineering teams while working on projects.
If you have experience in C# and PowerShell and are interested in learning how to write solid, well-tested code that will be used throughout the organization, join our team!

Responsibilities:

  • Learn and use new technologies and popular programming languages to design, build, and test our platform, Relativity
  • Work on scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering, technologies, and client component interaction through web services
  • Learn how to build highly distributable systems composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers.
  • Actively participate in the SCRUM process
  • Troubleshoot issues

Qualifications:

  • Current student, pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math or related area of study
  • Experience with and a passion for web development
  • Desire to work the Agile development methodology
  • Effective communicator
  • Team player

Enterprise SSD Firmware Engineer Intern

Summer 2021 internship applications are open September 2020. Samsung Semiconductor summer internships start in May/June 2021.

Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development. You’ll have the opportunity to work on different business initiatives while building in-depth technical knowledge and business acumen. This program will give you the opportunity work on complex solutions to that address some of the world’s most complex technological challenges.

OVERVIEW

Based in San Jose, California, Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. (SSI) is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, Ltd. and a world leader in Memory, System LSI and LCD technologies. We provide the widest range of memory, logic, storage devices, LED components and LCD/OLED panels to enhance the user experience in home entertainment, mobile devices, lighting and computing. SSI has advanced R&D labs focused on product design and research in memory, displays, logic, image sensors, and mobile technologies.

We are currently looking for exceptional software talent to join our team in San Jose, CA for the summer of 2021. We are currently looking for firmware/software engineers to join our rapidly growing effort to develop the next generation of enterprise solid-state flash technologies. Our core development focus is the host interface firmware layer that sits at the intersection of system software and flash management firmware. This key host interface firmware technology drives Samsung’s breakthrough V-NAND technology and enables our customer to power performance-oriented, demanding enterprise-class applications including Hyperscale data centers, big data processing and software-defined virtualized storage arrays and infrastructures.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Triage and root cause system, driver and device interoperability issues
  • Development and Debugging of firmware and software for cutting-edge enterprise SSD products
  • Debug, optimize & validate/test SSD firmware on embedded multi-core architectures
  • Support customer qualification of SSD products on OEM Storage Racks and Servers.
  • Learn operations of cutting-edge SSD, system-level operation and test tool suites
  • Write debug software; work with real-time systems and hardware debugging
  • Analyze NVMe or SAS protocol & debug utilities; write API for interpretation of data
  • Develop test cases for actual product development
  • Research and document main issues and feature gaps by testing existing products and system configurations
  • Gain expertise with SSD test automation environment
  • Work with technical lead to present reports to group detailing project work

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • Pursuing a BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or software-focused Electrical Engineering
  • Knowledge of storage systems and familiarity with flash devices
  • Comfortable in lab environment & interacting with teams; good communication skills
  • Knowledge of revision control tools and processes, including Subversion, Bazaar, or Git and knowledge of C/C++ development for embedded systems, including storage devices and other embedded platforms is desirable.
  • Knowledge or Experience with one or more of the following storage related technologies: NAND Flash/FTL, Fiber Channel, NVM Express (NVMe), SAS, SATA, SCSI, SSD, PCI Express (PCIe), eMMC or UFS is desirable
  • Knowledge or Experience with ARM or equivalent embedded multi-core microprocessor architectures & experience with JTAG/ICE debuggers & protocol analyzers is desirable
  • Scripting experience in one of Python/Perl/JavaScript is desirable
  • Familiarity and experience with modern agile software development methodologies and practices is desirable.

Key Role:

The Summer Games is an innovative internship program that attracts some of the nation’s best and brightest students. The goal is to develop a breakthrough idea or solution for one of our clients’ most pressing, complex, and multidimensional problems. This competitive and collaborative program attracts thousands of applicants for several hundred slots. Simulating a real-world startup accelerator environment, the interns are divided into teams, each working on a different challenge. Throughout the Games, interns receive mentorship from senior leaders, collaborate and experiment in Booz Allen’s innovation ecosystem, solve problems using Booz Allen’s products and unique engagement models, and leverage the power of rapid prototyping. The summer culminates with a final Challenge Cup competition and presentation to senior leadership. A past winner took the challenge of helping blind individuals navigate by using new technology, creating a functioning prototype, and developing a business and market penetration plan. Teams have also helped develop an app that gives military commanders an easy way to track real-time and open-source information about developing situations such as sudden attacks, fighting human trafficking, and even tracking the spread of a disease worldwide. These internships are located throughout the US and will depend on the needs of the business and the applicants' skills.

Our exclusive program is looking for talented students to work on teams for 10 weeks in our Central Maryland office, located between Washington, DC, and Baltimore, MD. Our region focuses on designing, building, and solving Cybersecurity problems for our national security clients and building skills to have a successful career here.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Ability to show enrollment in a degree program following Summer 2021 internship completion
  • Ability to show a minimum of 30 credit hours completed
  • Ability to obtain a security clearance
  • Pursuing a BA or BS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Operational Research, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering

Additional Qualifications:

  • TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

  • Below are the teams within Review/Core that are hiring interns:

Core
We are modernizing our front-end architecture, and we're looking to grow teams of engineers who are passionate about user experience, automation and performance.

You will be developing brand new features to make clients’ lives easier, and the user interface more intuitive, accessible, and performant. You will be working with JavaScript and frameworks like Aurelia and AngularJS. You will also be writing and maintaining API endpoints utilizing .NET, and connecting with cloud-based services such as Azure Logic Apps or Event Grid. You will be working in a blended build environment of both Node.js and MSBuild.You will be writing unit tests using Jasmine/Karma and NUnit.
If you love solving problems, building great products, working among strong teams, and want to make a visible impact, this role is for you.

Case Strategy
Case Strategy is a suite of applications which empowers case teams to construct winning cases by quickly and easily defining, validating and presenting their case strategy, while benefitting from a seamless integration into Relativity and all its features. Case Strategy consists of Case Dynamics, which assists users in collecting, organizing and analyzing facts, issues, organizations, people, interview questions and documents, while also seamlessly integrating into the Document Viewer and Transcript Viewer, which gives users the ability to upload, review, code, and annotate Transcript files in Relativity.

Case Strategy is a newly formed team and is full of energy. If you love solving complex problems and are thirsty for daily challenges, then come and join us, you will not be disappointed. You will mainly be working in JavaScript, Angular, and C#, but will also dabble in Aurelia and Relativity’s internal web components throughout 2020, as we are going to rewrite most of our front-end and make it adherent to the new look and feel of Relativity.

Review
The Review groups work on the Review Interface (RI), the part of Relativity where users spend 85% of their time. The RI is used to look at various documents, mark whether they’re relevant to the case, and optionally to apply redactions to hide sensitive information. We have just released a total rewrite of the RI. We continue to innovate on top of the new RI.
As part of our team, you will be using technologies such as Type Script, a superset of Java Script, Aurelia framework, and Azure. Projects might include optimizing new components or starting work on advanced features, such as an investigative UI, that will be delivered after the rewrite is done.

Potential projects include front end work to implement a new feature, back end Kepler work to support the front end, or build related projects. Past examples include adding a new search term in the front end, an Aurelia message to measure sign of life, or moving our build system to a new internal framework called Trident. We try to have all our projects make it into our shipping product instead of having them be “make work” projects.

position: Software Engineer Intern - Processing, Imaging & Productions
description:
We are Relativity. A market-leading, global tech company that equips legal and compliance professionals with a powerful platform to organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. The US Department of Justice, 199 of the Am Law 200, and more than 329,000 enabled users trust Relativity during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects.
Our SaaS product, RelativityOne, has become the fastest-growing product in the company's history and we have consistently been named a great workplace. As we grow, we continue to seek individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.
We believe that great talent is not bound by geography and that what you do matters more than where you do it. Relativity has assumed a hybrid work strategy, allowing choice and flexibility for employees to work either from home, a physical Relativity office location (once safe to do so), or a combination of the two, within certain logistical boundaries. Submit your application to learn more from our recruiters or contact us for more details.

  • Below are the teams within the Processing and Imaging & Productions product domain that are hiring interns:

Processing
Relativity's document "Processing" product is the fastest way to feed terabytes of complex data into Relativity's Review platform. As part of the Processing team, you will help build and enhance our cloud native and scalable engine that handles millions of files spanning hundreds of file types at market leading speeds. If an opportunity to tackle big-data scalability challenges while working with cloud technologies (Kubernetes, Kafka) and languages (Scala) excites you, then this is the right team for you. We are looking to add new members to our teams who share our passion for leveraging the latest technology to solve complex problems and build world class software.

Imaging & Productions
Relativity Productions is a suite of tools that help our customers efficiently Act on the truth they have discovered.
Our suite of tools enables our users to convert native documents to images so they can be redacted, OCR redacted documents to ensure that just the appropriate information is disseminated, stamp documents with metadata so they can be tracked, and bundle it all up in PDFs for easy distribution. So, whether it’s preparing a set of evidence for trial or responding to a FOIA request, our software helps users get the information ready to be delivered quickly and confidently.
Join our team as we work to add new capabilities and utilize cloud native technologies to support processing millions of documents daily in our SaaS product. To achieve this, you will build software using a diverse set of technologies including C#/.NET, JavaScript, C++, Azure, SQL, and Docker/Kubernetes.

Collections
Relativity Collect is a cloud native application to obtain electronically stored information from multitude of data sources. This is the first step in the e-discovery process.

Our data collectors are developed and executed on a state-of-the-art job framework called C4, which are an extension to Kubernetes technology. Our goal is to build highly scalable and performant data collectors from variety of cloud data sources while keeping the information defensible. Come join our team as we expand our footprint to collect information from O365, GSuites, Slack, Box to name a few.

Legal Hold
Our team owns the Legal Hold product, and they own and operate the Relativity OneLegal Hold SaaS instance, hosted in Azure.
A legal hold is a process that an organization uses to preserve all forms of relevant information when litigation is reasonably anticipated. Custodians subject to a litigation hold must preserve all electronically stored data (ESI) that they have access to. This requires no deletion or editing of files, documents, or any other ESI that is potentially relevant to a litigation.
Relativity Legal Hold is an application that attorneys, paralegals, and corporations use to manage legal hold workflows, communications, acknowledgements, reminders, and the custodian portal within their organization. Providing a sophisticated integration that includes active monitoring of Microsoft Office 365, Relativity Legal Hold also provides "Preservation in Place" holds ensuring that relevant ESI is preserved in its original state, even if a custodian disobeys a litigation hold notice and attempts to delete or edit relevant ESI. The product is executing Relativity's strategy to increase our footprint into corporations
Data Grid
Join our Data Grid Engineering group where we specialize in Organizing Data and Discovering the Truth faster and more efficiently. Our team is responsible storing, retrieving, and searching vast amounts of data efficiently by leveraging the latest technologies.
As part of the Data Grid team, you will be dealing with these unique challenges of storing, retrieving and indexing tremendous amount of data at blazing speeds.
You will be working with diverse set of technologies such as .NET, Azure, Elasticsearch, Docker, Kubernetes, and SQL. If an opportunity to deal with big-data, solve complex scalability, and performance challenges, and to learn an exciting set of technologies on a secure SaaS platform excites you, then this is the right team for you.

  • Learn and use new technologies and popular programming languages to design, build, and test our platform, Relativity
  • Work on scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering, technologies, and client component interaction through web services
  • Learn how to build highly distributable systems composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers.
  • Actively participate in the SCRUM process
  • Troubleshoot issues

  • Desire to work the Agile development methodology

position: Machine LRN Bell Labs Summer Intern
description:
About Nokia

At Nokia we create the technology to connect the world. Developing and delivering the industry's only end-to-end portfolio of network equipment, software, services and licensing that is available globally. Through our research teams, including the world-renowned Nokia Bell Labs, Nokia is leading the world to adopt end-to-end 5G networks that are faster, more secure and capable of revolutionizing lives, economies and societies. Nokia adheres to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. A truly global company, we are 160 nationalities working in more than 100 countries.

About Nokia Bell Labs

Help change the way people connect with the world…

Bell Labs, the Nobel Prize winning research organization, is accepting applications for our competitive internship program.

Bell Labs defines Nokia’s technological and architectural vision for the ICT industry, identifies the key challenges in this vision and invents solutions that are an order of magnitude (10X) better than existing solutions. It advises the industry on the economics of the vision and underlying technologies, and how best to transform to most efficiently achieve the goals. Driving thought leadership among customers and the industry strengthens Nokia’s role as a market leader and creator.
Discovering the possibilities that shape the human experience are at the heart of everything we do. Our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with world experts, and the best and brightest minds, who solve the most formidable networking and communications challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.
Our researchers are continually massively scaling the capabilities of networks from the data center to the end device, to change the way we live and work, by inventing breakthrough technologies to make networks and systems faster, smarter and greener.

As well as providing hands-on educational and collaborative experiences for a pool of talented and highly motivated students, our internship program will expand your field of study by exposing you to an unparalleled diversity of people, expertise and perspectives. In classic Bell Labs style, you will leave changed forever by an experience that will redefine your future.

Job Description

The Mathematics & Algorithms Research Group at Bell Labs-Research in Murray Hill, New Jersey, USA, invites applications for summer internship positions for Summer 2021. The internships cover research projects in a broad range of topics from stochastic modeling and optimization to deep reinforcement learning and autoencoder theory and applications. Candidates will have a strong and proven background in computing sciences and related fields and a natural interest in innovatively applying fundamental tools and methods in focused problem areas.

Job Responsibilities & Competencies

The successful applicant will conduct research in computing sciences and their applications to emerging network and data science. Primary duties and responsibilities include performing supervised research in math and computing science disciplines, such as computational math, algorithm design and development, (large-scale) optimization, distributed systems, computational methods for large data sets, complex networks, machine learning and deep learning. Familiarity with computational tools and techniques of data science and machine learning is required.

Qualifications

Candidates must hold a master’s degree or equivalent in CS, Computational & Applied Math, OR, ECE, or related fields such as computational physics.

Student Criteria:
Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above.
Must be enrolled as a full-time student.

Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements or may consider sponsoring short-term J1 Visa PhD students dependent upon program requirements.

Education Requested: Must be pursuing a degree in Biochemistry, Biomedical Engineering, Biophysics, Business Modeling, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Microbiology, Nanotechnology, Operations Research, Physics, Statistics, Systems Engineering and Telecommunications from an accredited college/university.

position: Intern, Solution Developer for Conversion Services Group
description:
Overview

Are you looking for a meaningful internship that will give you hands-on experience with a company that puts its employees first? Look no further than Hyland! As an intern, you will work side by side with various departments to complete projects, develop new skills, grow your professional network, and be a part of an amazing team. We value our customers and employees alike and will help you reach your full potential no matter where you are in the world. An internship at Hyland is the start on your path to future success. Check us out!

This position is good for someone interested in developer work and working with customers.

Position to start summer 2021

What you will be doing

  • Utilize department specific software and tools to complete assignments and tasks
  • Participate in team meetings
  • Liaise with other areas to resolve information or project requests by department staff
  • Compile and analyze information and develop reports, proposals, or documents
  • Maintain accurate documentation and records on all projects assigned
  • Engage with peers and team members to obtain knowledge to complete projects
  • Complete all assignments as directed
  • Follow all current standards utilized by your team

What will make you successful

  • Currently enrolled in an educational institution
  • Preferred majors - Computer Science, MIS, CIS
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office software products
  • Attentive to department needs as demonstrated by rapid and high-quality responsiveness to requests
  • Excellent interpersonal skills; able to maintain solid rapport with team members as well as maintain professionalism with those outside of department
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills that demonstrate a professional demeanor and the ability to interact with others with discretion and tact
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Capable of identifying and completing tasks independently, with a sense of urgency and ownership
  • Demonstrated success at maintaining high personal work standards
  • Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and tact
  • Or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the principal duties of the position.

What you can expect next
  • Hyland Recruiters thoroughly review every application and will contact you within 1 to 2 weeks regarding next steps. Be sure to add Hyland to your contacts list and check your spam folder so you never miss a message from us!
  • Any follow up questions? Email your Recruiter directly at Careers@Hyland.com.

Welcome to #HylandLife
Since 1991, it has been Hyland’s mission to help our employees, customers and partners exceed their potential with our industry-leading content services platform. Our employees exude a contagious energy and are passionate about what they do – whether it’s helping customers succeed, raising up their fellow Hylanders, or engaging in the communities where they live and work.

The #HylandLife hashtag encompasses our employee-centric culture. Our employees live our culture day in and day out by bringing their best self to work. Hyland supports them to do just that through career development resources, wellbeing programs and innovation practices. We thrive on diverse viewpoints and new ideas and believe that a positive, inclusive workplace is imperative to sustainable success.
As we’ve grown to a company of nearly 4,000 strong, we have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our communities. We strongly support employee initiatives and align our giving campaigns and programs to organizations that are important to them.

We are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity and maintain employment statistics on applicants.

Summary of Major Responsibilities:
Through hands-on experience as well as observational and mentorship activities, the IT Intern will have the opportunity to learn about several aspects of Information Security and working in a real business environment.

Primary responsibilities will be involved with day-to-day security operations, including access audits, role validation, response to security events, and general monitoring of security tools. This role will also help monitor compliance with all security policies and standards as well as with applicable regulations and laws.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Evaluation and remediation of customer-initiated incident tickets on information security topics (reported phishing e-mails, blocked web sites, etc.).
  • User account administration (Provisioning / de-provisioning, account permissions & auditing in a Microsoft Active Directory integrated environment).
  • Assisting fellow employees with the installation and use of a variety of information security-related applications.
  • Assistance in the development of documentation, user guides, FAQs and presentation materials related to information security topics and tools.
  • Act as a problem solver to drive successful completion of assigned tasks.
  • Establish positive working relationships with team members, vendors and IT customers.
  • Friendly and positive demeanor with a desire to demonstrate the high standards of customer service.
  • Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.
  • Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.
  • Regular and reliable attendance.
  • May be required to lift 10lbs on an infrequent basis up to 20% of the time.
  • Ability to use computers daily in an interactive manner for extended periods of time and up to 8 hours per day.
  • Ability to travel between facilities in the metropolitan area as needed.
  • Ability to frequently and accurately communicate with employees, customers, and vendors in person, via the telephone or by email.
Qualifications:
Minimum Requirements
  • Enrollment towards a degree in information technology or information security.
  • Preference given to candidates with a record of outstanding academic achievement.
  • Appetite to learn; general business acumen.
Preferred Requirements
  • Demonstrated aptitude for technology and an interest in pursuing a career in information technology and information security/cybersecurity.
#LI-SR1

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program are available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Build, deploy and monitor routers, switches, firewalls, DDoS and intrusion detection systems
  • Design and deliver highly available, resilient, and secure network automation capability that is cutting-edge
  • Configure and deploy network security devices to support business needs
  • Deploy access-list control based on business needs
  • Mitigate Network Security incidents by deploying controls and counter-measures
  • Liaise with vendors and professional services
  • Develop tools to aggregate and monitor network events
  • Swiftly execute change requests in communication with internal customers

What You Need for this Position

  • Passion and aptitude for learning technology and solving problems
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Basic networking knowledge including Ethernet, TCP/IP, OSI model, routing and switching
  • Working knowledge of routers and switches in a lab environment, course work or technical support position
  • Can work independently with minimal guidance as well as collaboratively with other team members
  • Excellent organization and time management skills
  • Broad knowledge and experience in scripting and programming with Python and shell script
  • Skilled at working with multiple encoding formats such as JSON and XML
  • Experience of interacting with network devices through Rest API’s
  • Knowledge of integrating existing network and infrastructure management platforms
  • Advanced knowledge of Linux, GIT, and code-sharing is a plus
  • Knowledge of public cloud ecosystems e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP is a plus
  • Experience using automation and orchestration software e.g. Chef, Puppet, Ansible is a plus
  • Currently pursuing a BS or MS in a computer science, networking, Information Security, or other related field
  • Graduation date of December 2021 or May 2022

Most importantly, a successful candidate will be passionate about technology. Keeping up with the latest advancements in the industry; spending time creating, building, and exploring with technical projects; an inquisitive attitude in regard to the workings of hardware and software; and overall, simply having fun and finding enjoyment in the field.

  • Below are the teams within Cloud Engineering that are hiring interns:

Cloud Engineering – Kubernetes Infrastructure Services
If you are interested in pushing a major architectural change through an enterprise-level engineering organization, the Infrastructure Services team is the right place for you. This team is focused on creating immutable infrastructure to host multiple shared services in the Azure cloud. Currently focused on Kubernetes and Jenkins as a Service, our team will continue to leverage cutting edge technologies such as Docker, Prometheus, Istio, and more. Our efforts will help Relativity Engineering teams completely transform our architecture to be more cloud native, while taking advantage of everything a distributed microservice architecture has to offer. Actual experience using these technologies is not a requirement, but we do seek candidates with strong engineering fundamentals, self-motivation, and an interest in DevOps principles (ownership from coding to Production support).

Potential Intern Projects/Work:
  • Development of Kubernetes operator applications
  • Redundancy and high availability functionality of Kubernetes cluster infrastructure
  • Testing automation System and dependency verifications

Cloud Engineering – RelativityOne File PaaS
Come join the FilePaaS team, which owns all unstructured data storage needs for the Relativity application. The FilePaaS team manages the internal storage servers upon which all of Relativity relies. We develop and maintain the infrastructure and the control plane that facilitates the provisioning and consumption of file storage space. We develop storage-layer abstractions to increase our platform's data management capabilities, reduce costs, and increase business agility. Our key challenge: how do we simplify and optimize the management of petabyte-scale cloud storage to the delight of our customers and developers?

Our team is looking to build out the next generation of infrastructure. Join us as we work to leverage cloud-native technologies to respond to the scale of Relativity’s increasing growth as well as to idiosyncratic nature of massive-scale storage. To achieve this, our team is using a diverse set of technologies, including Linux, Azure, Kubernetes, Docker, Powershell, C#/.NET, and SQL. As a member of this team, you will contribute to optimizing and refining the existing service, maintaining its operational state, adopting design and development best practices, and working with senior engineers to implement new features. You may work on our storage abstraction layer, data plane, as well as the control plane that manages these in order to deliver petabyte-scale, cloud-native storage solutions for Relativity.

Cloud Engineering - RelativityOne SQL PaaS
Our SQL PaaS team is building a SQL Platform as a Service (PaaS) unique to Relativity based on SQL Server and Azure cloud technologies. We are building a proprietary high-availability replication and database movement technology. The SQL PaaS is responsible for orchestration, provisioning, scale, configuration, and monitoring of data hosted in the platform. The technology is deployed globally in multiple Azure regions and hosts hundreds of terabytes of data and hundreds of thousands of SQL Databases.

Here you will have the opportunity to solve significant complex scalability, availability and performance challenges while learning new cloud development best practices using technologies like Azure, .NET core, Serverless Compute, Chef, PowerShell, and Jenkins. If being part of a team building out a PaaS sounds interesting to you, we would love to hear from you!

Cloud Engineering – R1 Monitoring & Site Reliability
The RelativityOne Monitoring and Site Reliability teams build systems to detect infrastructure and application level events before they impact customers. We funnel that data to RelativityOne Operations, Business Analysis, and Engineering teams for in-depth analysis on performance, utilization, and availability.

Join our team as we implement end to end observability with cutting edge technologies such as OpenTelemetry, powerful timeseries databases such as Splunk, and machine learning and analytics to monitor a SaaS application. The technical environment includes Kubernetes, OpenTelemetry, Azure functions, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Event Hub (Kafka), and Kubernetes; we code in C#.NET, Go and Powershell.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn and use new technologies and popular programming languages to design, build, and test our platform, Relativity
  • Work on scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering, technologies, and client component interaction through web services
  • Learn how to build highly distributable systems composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers.
  • Actively participate in the SCRUM process
  • Troubleshoot issues

Qualifications:

  • Current student, pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math or related area of study
  • Experience with and a passion for web development
  • Desire to work the Agile development methodology
  • Effective communicator
  • Team player

Let’s face it. Technology is moving way too fast for commercial security solutions to keep up. Even choosing best of breed solutions means you have to integrate tools not built to work together out-of-the-box. At some point you have to build some custom tooling to get to the next level.

That’s where the Cvent Security Engineering team comes in. We are maturing our security capabilities through a combination of commercial solutions, open source solutions, and custom developed solutions. As Cvent develops solutions at the leading edge of technology, we are racing along with them to develop solutions to secure them.

What You Will Be Doing

This position is a technical, hands-on role that involves small scale software development support work as well configuration and customization of security tools, in order to facilitate analysis of network and web threats, security architectures, new technology designs, and other areas. Custom development of solutions in AWS Cloud will be at the forefront of the work using native AWS solutions like Lambda, Config, EC2, ECS, SecurityHub, GuardDuty, and more. You should also be able to adapt quickly and willing to learn new ways to implement scripting in a fast-paced and high-profile technology landscape. You will work with the latest and best of breed security tools, systems, and network technologies. A thirst for knowledge, a curious mind, and the desire to continuously stay abreast of new developments in the dynamic security space is a must.

You will work with and mentor under a team of security engineers with decades of combined experience. As our past learning programs and internships have demonstrated, you will get valuable knowledge and experience at an accelerated rate beyond what a traditional education can offer.

Position Duties:

  • Work with a team to help develop solutions to drive automation for the Security Engineering and Operations teams across our external products and enterprise
  • Support creation of solutions to leverage and improve upon AWS native tools in order to facilitate protection and detection capabilities
  • Script solutions to access and unify data from different security telemetry with data normalization and ETL
  • Develop integrations between automation platforms, cybersecurity tools, and other information systems
  • Collaborate and communicate effectively with the Security Team
  • Stay abreast of emerging technologies related to security and security automation

What You Need for this Position:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related degree
  • Comfortable with Python or Java
  • Familiarity with Web Services Development and API Experience
  • Passion and aptitude for learning other languages as necessary
  • Familiarity with the AWS platform and services such as Config, Lambda, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, S3, WAF, GuardDuty, Shield
  • Ability to adapt to a hyper-growth pace and changing priorities

position: Spring 2021 Intern, Electronics Simulation Research and Development - MS or PhD
description:
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

ANSYS empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching internship program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists.

As an Electronics Simulation Research and Development Intern, you will join a team responsible for the R&D of state-of-the-art electromagnetics, circuit and system simulators.

This is a 40-hour per week paid position, starting January 2021 and concluding April 2021.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Perform testing and benchmarking of implemented features
  • Identify issues and assist developers for the resolution
  • Develop and automate unit and regression tests



MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Pursuing MS or PhD in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, computer science, computational electromagnetics, or related technical field
  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and maintain a GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Experience with both Windows and Linux development environments
  • Knowledge of scientific programming (e.g. C/C++, Python, Java)



CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
  • Customer focus
  • Results and Accountability
  • Innovation
  • Transparency and Integrity
  • Mastery
  • Inclusiveness
  • Sense of urgency
  • Collaboration and Teamwork


WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

position: Deep Learning Computer Vision Researcher-Scientist Intern
description:
Deep Learning Computer Vision Researcher-Scientist Intern

Summer 2021 internship applications are open September 2020. Samsung Semiconductor summer internships start in May/June 2021.

Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development. You’ll work with the teams that create new computing system architectures needed to support emerging machine learning applications, internet of things (IoT) and edge computing that benefit millions of users. This program will give you the opportunity work on complex solutions to that address some of the world’s most complex technological challenges.

OVERVIEW

Based in San Jose, California, Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. (SSI) is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, Ltd. and a world leader in Memory, System LSI and LCD technologies. We provide the widest range of memory, logic, storage devices, LED components and LCD/OLED panels to enhance the user experience in home entertainment, mobile devices, lighting and computing. SSI has advanced R&D labs focused on product design and research in memory, displays, logic, image sensors, and mobile technologies.

Candidate will conduct research on deep learning for application processors and multimedia processors with applications such as camera enhancement, computer vision, or image and video processing. Candidate will work as part of a team on the system design, implementation, and verification of algorithms for application processors and multimedia processors.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Write computer software to develop algorithms and simulate system performance.
  • Develop machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
  • Develop novel computer vision or image processing applications.
  • Develops rules and methodologies for data collection and analysis.
  • Coordinates with other engineers and technical experts in developing machine learning algorithms to learn information from the collected data.
  • Prepare presentations, technical reports and patent applications that reflect the results.

REQUIRED SKILLS

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Expertise in signal processing, computer vision, image processing, deep learning, and/or machine learning.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • C/C++, Python, and MATLAB coding skills, popular deep learning frameworks.
  • Excellence in writing technical reports and high quality publications.

PREFERED SKILLS

  • Publications in highly ranked journals and conferences
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with experience or M.Sc. degree. PhD candidates are preferred.


***********************************************************************************************************************

Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.- the second largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays.

***********************************************************************************************************************

Scout helps create reliable and safe education solutions where students can learn and socialize in a remote or hybrid school environment.

Many families have been struggling to navigate a remote or hybrid school year. Schools are not fully equipped to create rich learning experiences in this environment, and families lack reliable alternatives. Parents have tried to homeschool their children, and frankly that’s been a challenging balancing act. Students are missing out on not just an education, but also socialization with peers that’s a crucial part of childhood.

Scout brings together families with our community of learning facilitators to create learning pods. Scout provides the structure for pods to work -- helping families create pods, interview and screen learning facilitators in a highly selective matching process, set predictable rates and payment schedules, provide customizable community guidelines, and have real estate partnerships for pods that request an alternate learning venue.

This is a unique opportunity to become a core member of an exciting high-growth company and take on an active role in helping to build it from the ground up. This role is for someone who wants to be challenged on a daily basis to solve complex problems and create value for parents, educators, and students. Our applicants will be asked to think strategically about the broader issues of remote learning and help Scout provide a lasting solution for all stakeholders involved. We are seeking driven and passionate undergraduate students who want to work at a newly launched startup and take part in creating an education solution that is safe and effective for all. As a Software Development Intern, you will be provided with a high level of autonomy that comes with an equal amount of responsibility.

Role and Responsibilities

As a Software Development Intern your responsibilities include:

  • Design and code elegant solutions to broadly defined problems.
  • Work in an agile environment to deliver high-quality software.
  • Lead test-driven development cycles.
  • Design consumer-facing experiences that will be used by parents and families throughout NYC.

Qualifications and requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field at time of application.
  • Knowledge of the syntax of programming languages such as Java, C/C++, and Python.
  • Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving, and complexity analysis.
  • Preferred: Experience with JavaScript or web application development languages and processes
  • Preferred: Experience with JavaScript libraries Node.js, React.js, and Angular.js

What we offer

  • Work as a core member of a start-up team from day one
  • Ownership of your own projects and responsibilities
  • Day-to-day communication with the founding team
  • Opportunity to contribute to a fast-growing company and learn how a start-up is built from the ground up
  • We pay our interns!

About us:

Kiva (kiva.org) is an international nonprofit with a mission to expand financial access to help underserved communities thrive. We run a global marketplace platform to crowdfund microloans for financially excluded entrepreneurs, farmers and students around the world. Our organization combines the culture and technological passion of an internet start-up with the compassion and empathy of a non-profit to create impact and opportunity at global scale. In just 13 years, we have raised more than $1.2 billion in loan capital for 2.7 million borrowers in 83 countries. Our lenders fund over $10 million in loans every month. With offices in San Francisco, Portland, New York, Nairobi, and Bangkok, Kiva's team includes 100+ employees and 400+ volunteers worldwide. Our team is growing as we pursue exciting new opportunities to create a financially inclusive world.

Role overview:

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will be mentored by engineers from different technical backgrounds who all share a passion for technology, solving meaningful problems, and making tangible impact. You will join an established team at Kiva during an exciting time of growth and innovation. The ideal intern candidate is passionate about both our organizational mission and learning new skills. Effective communication is among the most important tools in your toolbox. You are always looking at how things can be improved and examine problems from all angles.

Internship Program:

  • Our 10 to 12-week summer internship program (with the option to extend) provides you with a comprehensive introduction to the microfinance, nonprofit, and tech spaces while being fully integrated into a team.
  • You will have the option to complete the internship remotely or be based in Kiva's San Francisco or Portland if COVID-19 safety measures permits.
  • You will report to and work closely with an engineering manager while also having the support of an engineering mentor buddy.
  • You will have the opportunity to select from a wide range of projects. At the end of your internship, you will present your project to the engineering organization.
  • We will pair you with a dedicated engineer to ensure the success of your project. They will be your go-to person for any questions, suggestions, advice, and providing constructive feedback.
  • You will engage with executives and industry leaders through intern and company wide events.
  • You will participate in professional career development workshops and memorable fun events with fellow interns, teammates, and full-timers.

You will:

  • Learn about microfinance, nonprofit, and engineering best practices at Kiva.
  • Learn and work across a variety of technologies like Vue.js, node.js, kotlin, cloud-based microservices, and distributed ledger.
  • Learn modern software engineering processes and experience development cycles from conception to deployment into production.
  • Contribute to our core services and build scalable programs that standardize information flow and increase operational efficiency.
  • Be part of a close-knit engineering team and have an experienced mentor who considers it their job to make sure you're growing the skills you need.
  • Own a project that has a serious impact on Kiva's work. For example, a past intern project involved securely and quickly translating 3M+ citizen identities into blockchain wallets while another intern used the latest open source visual regression tools to ensure a consistent user experience when onboarding new banking customers in communities with limited financial assess.

Qualifications:

  • Preferred: Currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or a related technical discipline.
  • Excited to learn new languages and technologies.
  • Willing to dive in and learn by doing.
  • Ready to work with others to solve hard problems.

What we offer:

  • Opportunities to improve real lives, solve hard problems, and change the world.
  • Friendly, supportive, and adventurous environment with a team of engaged colleagues.
  • Opportunities to connect with and learn from colleagues and partners around the world.

Perks:

  • Professional development and skills workshops.
  • Open invitation to join Kiva's Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and social activities such as happy hours and coffee chats.
  • References gladly given for successful participants.

A diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is an integral part of Kiva's culture. We actively welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a great place to work. Join us and help us achieve our mission!

Description:

What does a Software Developer do?

A Software Developer plans, designs, tests and deploys computer programs and applications. Their duties include identifying the needs of users, outlining technical requirements and specifications and overseeing programming activities.

Developers test software performance against specifications, implement programs and update existing products to improve efficiency and safety. Their responsibilities cover native computer applications, mobile apps and video games, among others.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Collaborating with management, departments and customers to identify end-user requirements and specifications
  • Designing algorithms and flowcharts to create new software programs and systems
  • Producing efficient and elegant code based on requirements
  • Testing and deploying programs and applications
  • Troubleshooting, debugging, maintaining and improving existing software
  • Compiling and assessing user feedback to improve software performance
  • Observing user feedback to recommend improvements to existing software products
  • Developing technical documentation to guide future software development projects.
  • In some instances, must be able to build software from scratch.

-5 years minimum prior work experience

- This role requires candidates who are excellent communicators, are adaptable and have strong analytical skills.
Experience requirements

-Must be familiar with the software development life cycle including the planning, design, development and implementation, deployment and maintenance stages.

- Must require an in-depth knowledge of different programming languages, frameworks and tools.

- Must know how to write elegant code based on product specifications and requirements.

- Must be familiar with testing, debugging and improving their code and the work of their team members to deliver products on schedule.

- Must have the ability to learn new programming languages, collect feedback and improve existing software, also require a good understanding of algorithms, flow charts and mathematical concepts that form the basis of computer programming.

Activities will include one or more of the following tasks as determined by program needs, project priorities, intern capabilities and interests:

Perform experiments as directed by scientists and engineers: Determine temperature from I/V characteristics; Develop new liquid metal ion source (LMIS) technology; Perform periodic thermal imaging pyrometry and monitor of ongoing experiments; Cold fieed emitter (CFE) assembly (etch W tips, attach, SEM); High current ion source monitoring and characterization; Make noise measurements on Schottky emitters; Take energy spread measurements and/or brightness measurements

About Protective Insurance

Protective Insurance specializes in marketing and underwriting insurance for the transportation industry. Backed by our successful history and financial strength, we offer diverse, innovative products in the property and casualty insurance market.


The Protective Internship Program

Protective Insurance is proud to offer an internship program that truly prepares students for the workforce. We provide resources to help interns sharpen skills and make meaningful contributions in their departments. Protective Insurance is embarking on an exciting IT transformation journey focused on agile development processes, cloud architecture, cloud and mobile application development in support of our corporate goal to make roads safer. We are seeking an experienced QA Test Automation Engineer to join our scrum teams. Focus will be on automated testing for new-platform applications. The apps being developed will integrate with Protective systems to deliver insurance products and services on web and mobile devices. Are you passionate about solving highly complex technical challenges and moving fast? Does the idea of working on a platform to revolutionize the way the world views TV excite you? If so, then Simulmedia may be looking for you. We’re a company using data, science and software to make TV advertising powerful, provable and profitable.


Simulmedia is seeking Software Engineering Interns for our Fall program!


Your Role


As an intern on the engineering team you’ll have a direct impact on the development of technologies that are shaping the way advertisers deliver performance on TV. You’ll have the opportunity to tackle challenges across a number of different parts of the our technology platform, from user-facing web applications and visualizations to back-end APIs and services that handle massive amounts of data at scale.


Responsibilities

  • Develop & test software using primarily Python, Ruby or Javascript.
  • Work in a fast-paced agile environment especially as it pertains to new technology and complex data-centric problems.
  • Learn quickly and be excited by big challenges.

Qualifications


  • Pursuing a degree (Bachelors or Masters) in Computer Science or a related field with demonstrated programming experience.
  • Preferred: Experience with web programming languages (Python, Ruby, Javascript or Java). We are not tied to one language.
  • High levels of creativity and quick problem solving capabilities
  • Due to the pandemic and limited access to our NYC office, this internship will be 100% remote.

What is Simulmedia?


Simulmedia is a New York-based TV ad platform that enables predictable, scalable customer growth. Job Title:

Security Engineering Internship

Requisition ID:

R003289

Job Description:

SECURITY ENGINEERING INTERN

Greetings, students! We’re geared up here to offer another round of epic internship experiences in summer 2021. The internship program offers the opportunity to pause your studies for one summer and work side-by-side with Blizzard Entertainment employees in your area of interest, doing real work that oftentimes ends up in production. As such, we hold you to the same high standards as anybody else in the company.

Just like our gameplay experiences, Blizzard internships are a fully immersive experience. We want interns who are enthusiastic about what they want to do for a living and excited to come in every day to learn and contribute in this hyper-creative atmosphere. Being fully engaged with our team also means communicating effectively and maintaining an open mind - one that is receptive to feedback and able to adapt and grow. Your hobbies and interests can also play in your favor. Passion for technology, gaming, game development, and an in-depth knowledge of Blizzard games, products, and services will always be a plus with us, regardless of the position you’re applying for. Be passionate about who you are, be into our industry, and be willing to go all-in and embrace this opportunity to the fullest!

We are currently planning on having our internships in-person. With that said, the safety of our employees is a top priority and we are comfortable transitioning our internship to be 100% virtual if needed.

QUEST OBJECTIVES

  • Work with engineers on one of Blizzard Entertainment’s esteemed security team
  • Partner closely with a mentor to design, implement, and debug software or security tools to drive the next generation of game and application security across the Battle.net platform.
  • Expand your skills and learn new technologies in the security space

QUEST REQUIREMENTS

  • Currently enrolled in a college or university and graduating December 2021 or later
  • Computer Science / Cybersecurity Degree or similar preferred
  • Available for a 12-week internship starting on late May or late June
  • Passionate about learning what it takes to be a successful security engineer in the gaming industry
  • Candidates must apply with a resume and please include your participation in any cybersecurity events or conferences (CTFs, Defcon, etc.)

INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES

One of Blizzard Entertainment’s core values is “Play Nice, Play Fair” – we believe that epic gaming experiences begin with a level playing field. Because of that, we passionately do everything we can to combat cheating in our games. We want YOU to join this fight!

Game Security Engineering: During the internship, you will get to contribute directly to the game security development efforts here at Blizzard! You will get real-world experience and advancing our technology against cheaters trying to get an advantage across our games.

  • Proficiency in C++/C, Python, Linux/Unix or any other scripting or programming language
  • Experience with security engineering concepts and methodologies
  • Experience cheating and reverse engineering cheats for games

Application Security Engineering: Our application security team works to secure Blizzard’s family of software applications. You will gain real-world experience in application security and software development. Join the team that is on the cutting edge of securing some of the most used applications in the gaming industry.

  • Proficiency in Java, Javascript, C++ or any web-based technology or programming language
  • An understanding of application security concepts and methodologies
  • Interest in security development

Blizzard Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster a deeply collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us!

The Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) Research Team brings together world-class researchers, developers, and engineers to create the future of AR and VR. These technologies have the potential for enormous global impact, and our interns work directly towards making this potential a reality. The Surreal Vision team is looking for research interns to tackle the most ambitious problems in machine perception.In this internship, you will work on research problems at the forefront of industry and academia and beyond. You will be working with a team building a new generation of end-to-end real-time dynamic 3D scene understanding and photorealistic reconstruction systems. The range of topics in machine learning, computer vision and graphics span novel approaches to 3D reconstruction, object detection and tracking, human pose estimation and tracking, large-scale online inference and optimization, state estimation, novel scene, object and material representations and their estimation.Our internships are twelve (12) to twenty four (24) weeks long and you have the option to start at various dates throughout the year.
  • Fundamental research and development of ideas that extend the state of the art
  • Analysis and improvement of efficiency, accuracy, scalability and stability of currently deployed systems
  • Design and implementation of algorithms
  • Development and analysis of prototype experimental systems
  • Collaboration with and support of other researchers across various disciplines
  • Communication of research agenda, progress and results

  • Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD in the field of Computer Science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Robotics, Physics or related fields
  • Experience in one or more of the following: machine learning, perception, information theory, 3D geometry, 3D reconstruction, graphics, tracking, Bayesian inference, optimization, system building, physics-based simulation, statistical analysis of data, or mathematical modeling

As a Photomask Data Scientist Intern at Micron Technology, we will integrate you into the exciting field of complex data analysis within a photomask development environment. You will be taught photomask processing and how this knowledge can be used to tackle complex problems using diverse datasets.

The types of activities for a successful intern would include:

  • Extract data from different databases through various query languages
  • Applying data cleansing, outlier identification, and missing data techniques
  • Statistical modeling
  • Feature extraction and analysis
  • Uncover patterns in the data from which predictive models, actionable insights or solutions can be developed
  • Evolve model building into supervised and unsupervised machine learning


The objective is to challenge and develop critical thinking and problem-solving that will coincide with a research task designed to improve the area’s operational capability and then present the results at the appropriate forum. At the end of the intern period, you will have a deep understanding of the systems, challenges, and problem-solving strategies commonly used in today’s research and development photomask manufacturing world.


We are looking for interns who are familiar with software development and capable of critical thinking, prioritization, and analytical skills along with strong verbal and written interpersonal skills. We need highly motivated interns, with a good work ethic, and can work independently.

Experience with or the passion to learn the following elements will aid in a successful intern experience:

  • Machine learning and other advanced analytical methods
  • Fluency in Java, Python and/or R
  • pySpark and/or SparkR and/or SparklyR
  • Hadoop (Hive, Spark, HBase)
  • Teradata and/or another SQL databases
  • Tensorflow, and/or other statistical software including scripting capability for automating analyses
  • ETL/ELT, Apache Ni-Fi
  • Tableau and/or JMP
  • Working with time series data, images, and data with frequently changing distributions is a plus

Required Education:

Completed sophomore level class work for a 4-year program or junior level class work for a 5-year program in one of the following bachelor degrees: Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Physics, or related field of study.

position: Grainger Technology Group Intern - Software Engineering
description:
Grainger Overview
At Grainger, we’re committed to our purpose – We Keep the World Working. Grainger is a leading global supplier of maintenance, repair, and operational supplies, providing services and solutions for every industry. Our 25,000 employees are driven to serve customers and the community in exceptional ways; focusing on delivering the highest level of service leveraging the most innovative solutions. In the Grainger Technology Group, we deliver the technology platforms, systems, and services that power the Grainger business. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll be able to develop your talents and make a difference. Grainger is a Fortune 500 company and a perennial member of Fortune magazine's Most Admired Companies list.

The Program

The GTG internship is a 10-12 week program based out of our downtown Chicago office. You will work alongside team members on functionality that has a direct impact to the business. Throughout the summer, there will be plenty of time for networking, professional development, and social events. At the end of the internship, you will present your work to senior leadership.

The internship is paid and free housing is provided in downtown Chicago for all Grainger Technology Group interns. At this time, we plan for our 2021 internship program to take place in-person. However, we are actively monitoring the COVID-19 pandemic and will take all necessary steps to ensure team member safety.


The Role

We are looking for engineers with strong technical skills in various disciplines including data engineering, data visualization, cloud infrastructure engineering, performance and site reliability, networking, security, mobile development, web development, and more. You will contribute your skills to a specific team and may have the opportunity to work with your intern peers on additional projects. Through your work and other development opportunities, you will grow your technical skills and understand how our technology stack empowers our business to serve our customers.

  • Develop new features, identify and implement bugfixes
  • Operate effectively in an Agile development environment
  • Demonstrate strong analytical skills; Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Display a proactive, results oriented attitude; superb work ethic and flexibility to work in an environment of constant change

  • Ability to learn new programming languages
  • Preferred major GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Expected graduation with a Bachelors or Masters degree between Winter 2021 – Spring 2022
  • Does not require sponsorship

Better is redefining homeownership and making it simpler, faster—and most importantly—more accessible for everyone. We leverage technology and expertise to find ways that we can make the homebuying journey more approachable and understandable.

  • Right now we’re funding over $2 billion in home loans per month
  • We’ve funded over $14 billion in loans and $3.5 billion in insurance
  • We ranked #11 on Fortune’s Best Places to Work in Financial Services 2020
  • Our Founder and CEO was named in Comparably's Top 25 CEOs for Diversity
  • We were listed to Forbes’ FinTech 50 2020
  • And #15 on the 2020 CNBC Disruptor 50
  • We’ve secured over $254 million from our investors to date

Our company is made up of driven, passionate people who bring their unique backgrounds and perspectives to everything we do and we are committed to fostering diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion. We see the perspectives that each person brings and a diverse workforce as essential for individual and collective success. We believe it’s important to foster a company culture that encourages curiosity and passion—from employee resource groups and learning opportunities to team outings and community outreach.

A Better opportunity:

Help us hack a thirteen trillion dollar industry by building a product that will allow more people than ever before to own a home and build wealth rather than rent for life. Our tech team is still small but growing, and you will be a big part of defining the technical direction and culture. We encourage proposals for projects off the beaten path, experimentation with different frameworks and libraries, and doing as you see fit to solve problems.

Here’s what to expect during your 10-12 week internship:

  • You’ll have a direct impact on how Better is redefining the traditional mortgage industry. We’re putting the customer first and using technology to rebuild the homeownership process from the ground up.
  • You will work on a specific project critical to Better’s needs. We love when our engineers are versatile, display leadership qualities and are enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology in the mortgage industry forward.
  • You’ll work in a collaborative team, be mentored by top engineers in the industry and see your work go live quickly.

This is a paid, remote internship.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, or Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline with at least one remaining semester of school left after completion of the internship

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Excited to work in a fast paced, high growth startup environment
  • A commitment to writing understandable, maintainable, and reusable software
  • A desire to deliver and a strong sense of accountability for your work
  • Experience programming in a modern language such as Python, Scala, Java, Node.js, Go

Applications close October 23, 2020.

The Better mission is rooted in values that drive us.

  • We do what’s in the best interest of the consumer, not ourselves
  • We have growth mindsets, not fixed ones
  • We believe that success lies in execution, not credentials
  • We act like owners, not just employees
  • We work to find answers on our own, not wait for them to be given to us

Our mission speaks for itself—we continue to outpace the industry at every turn. We’ve recently joined forces in partnership with Ally Bank, and our backers have helped build some of the most transformative tech and finance companies in history. Kleiner Perkins, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Citigroup, Activant Capital, Ally Bank, and others have invested in our vision for what homeownership can be.
