position: Graduate Student Mechanical, Electrical and Firmware Internship/Co-op - Fall 2020
description:
Graduate Student Mechanical, Electrical and Firmware Internship/Co-op - Fall 2020


Vecna Robotics has openings for graduate student interns and/or co-ops in mechanical, electrical and firmware within our Autonomy Division, as described below. We will evaluate your candidacy for each area. Co-op positions are preferred, but those available for a fall internship only will also be considered.
In these roles you will:
Learn how to design robots and contribute to their development in one of these disciplines: Mechanical, Electrical or Firmware.

Across all functional areas, we are looking for:
  • Currently pursuing MS/PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, or equivalent engineering field with a focus on robotics
  • Experience with real robots
Additional considerations for Mechanical and Electrical:
  • Experience with Solidworks
  • Ability to get your hands dirty and work on prototypes and testing rigs
Additional considerations for Firmware:
  • Hands-on experience with embedded software
  • Proficiency with C/C++
About Vecna Robotics:
Vecna Robotics is an exciting engineering startup in the process of scaling its suite of autonomous, material handling robots for the warehouse and supply industry. Our technology is designed to integrate seamlessly with workers for safe and flexible bulk transportation and fulfillment in a dynamic environment. As we become a leading producer of these collaborative warehouse robots, we seek candidates who thrive on developing creative solutions to daily challenges and can approach those challenges from the customer point of view. Our talented and hardworking team values self-discipline, leadership, innovation, and learning.
We are an equal opportunity employer. We encourage and celebrate diversity.

About Building and Land Technology

Building and Land Technology (BLT), founded in 1982, is a privately held real estate developer, manager and private equity firm. BLT is vertically integrated and has invested in, developed, owned and managed in excess of 25 million square feet of commercial, hotel and residential properties across 26 states. BLT is also the largest franchisee of Sotheby s residential real estate brokerage, with 28 offices and 1,000+/- real estate agents. To learn more about BLT visit http://www.bltoffice.com and https://bltliveworkplay.com/

BLT is a fast-paced, growth-oriented real estate, development, management and investment company with millions of square feet under management and in the development pipeline. In the past 10 years, BLT has developed more than 5,700 residential units in the tri-state area with 1,000+ under development today. BLT is also the largest office landlord in Stamford and Norwalk, CT and is the developer of Harbor Point (www.harborpt.com), a seven million square foot mixed-used development in Stamford, North 7, a mixed use complex in Norwalk, the Beacon (www.thebeaconjc.com), an 1,155 unit historic renovation in Jersey City, and numerous other large-scale real estate developments.

IT Intern

The responsibilities of this position include:

  • Provide onsite and remote IT support to staff members.
  • Fix issues with computer hardware and software
  • Analyze information, identify current and potential problems, and propose solutions
  • Manages the helpdesk ticketing system
  • Manages IT inventory
  • Followup with IT team members on assigned helpdesk tasks
  • Assist with IT projects from time

The qualifications and requirements for this position include:

  • Associate Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or Computer Security.
  • Working knowledge of computers, servers, and networks
  • Strong communication skills. The ability to provide exceptional customer service to our portfolio (commercial & residential properties, partners & clients).
  • The ability to work efficiently and expedite tasks in a time-sensitive manner, as well as work in a team environment.
  • Knowledge of the following software and hardware:
    • Windows OS
    • MAC OS
    • Smart (i.e. Apple and Android) devices
    • Microsoft 365 Applications
    • Audio Visual (AV) Systems
    • Web conferencing tools (i.e. Zoom, GoToMeeting, Webex, etc.)
    • HP, DELL, Lenovo, Canon (Workstations, Printers, Copiers, etc.)

About Nokia

At Nokia we create the technology to connect the world. Developing and delivering the industry's only end-to-end portfolio of network equipment, software, services and licensing that is available globally. Through our research teams, including the world-renowned Nokia Bell Labs, Nokia is leading the world to adopt end-to-end 5G networks that are faster, more secure and capable of revolutionizing lives, economies and societies. Nokia adheres to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. A truly global company, we are 160 nationalities working in more than 100 countries.

About Nokia Bell Labs

Over its nearly 100-year history, Nokia Bell Labs has invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communication networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has resulted in nine Nobel Prizes, four Turing Awards, three Japan Prizes and a plethora of National Medals of Science and Engineering, as well three Emmys, two Grammys and an Oscar for technical innovations. Nokia Bell Labs continues to conduct disruptive research focused on solving the challenges of the new digital era and innovating the technology that will define the next industrial revolution.

Job Description

Research & Innovation (RIN) comprises the conduction of extensive fundamental scientific research on a field of expertise aiming at fuller, more complete knowledge and understanding of the fundamental aspects of a concept or a phenomenon. Covers encouragement of disruptive innovations and the provision of novel solutions while building up robust intellectual property for Nokia. The Research Scientist conducts research projects investigating fundamental scientific and conceptual problems with the goal of breaking new ground which could lead to new inventions, new or enhanced products, or new business or market opportunities by disruptive and innovative solutions. Creates a substantial competitive advantage by generating company intellectual property.

Job Responsibilities & Competencies

The primary duty for this position is to design and standardize current and future radio technologies. The candidate should be able to perform analysis and simulation of cellular radio systems to support the design and development of algorithms and radio technologies, research new technologies, publish key results, and file patent disclosures at the end of their internship period.
  • Analyze system designs and provide associated technical recommendations and reports for 5G evolution and beyond broadband technologies (3G Partnership Project (3GPP).
  • Investigate multiple antenna techniques (MAS) for 5G Evolution systems for downlink and uplink. MAS techniques includes transmit diversity, single user MIMO (SU-MIMO), multiuser MIMO (MU-MIMO), Massive MIMO with focus on Multi-TRP, Digital beamforming and Advanced CSI methods.
  • Contribute towards 5G evolution and beyond technologies specifically in bands from sub 6 GHz and mm Wave bands. The job includes development of channel models in bands beyond 100 GHz, physical layer and MAC design at these higher bands including suitable MIMO/beamforming technologies, self-backhauling technologies and system/link simulations to validate the design.
  • Non-terrestrial communication, V2X, Industrial IoT (IIoT) using 5G New Radio evolution and beyond technologies.
  • File multiple patent disclosures related to 5G Evolution and beyond air-interface and MAC design.
  • Publications of analysis and results related to 5G Evolution and beyond both externally and internally. Externally, it should be published at an IEEE conference, magazine or journal.
Qualifications
  • Machine learning in physical layer
  • The candidate needs to have very good writing skills
Student Criteria:
Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above. Should be enrolled in a Masters and Ph.D. program in Electrical and Computer Engineering.
Must be enrolled as a full-time student.

Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements or may consider sponsoring short-term J1 Visa PhD students dependent upon program requirements.

Education Requested: Must be pursuing a degree in Biochemistry, Biomedical Engineering, Biophysics, Business Modeling, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Microbiology, Nanotechnology, Operations Research, Physics, Statistics, Systems Engineering and Telecommunications from an accredited college/university.

Imagine creating technology that has the potential to change the world. Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people’s lives and help to overcome some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves. Come create the technology to connect the world.

Who we are:
Steelcase was founded as an office furniture maker, and we've evolved into the global leader in workplace solutions. We apply our insights to the intersection of space, technology, and furniture, helping individuals and teams in leading companies around the world to have a better day at work.

We pursue innovation, strive for sustainability and develop insights in every part of our business.

Why people choose to work with us:
We are an award-winning analytics organization recognized for transforming the organization by using our insights to positively impact business processes and decision-making. You’ll have a specific focus in the Lean Quality organization working on improving our data collection and customer experience metrics.
We believe you’ll grow from being mentored and collaborating with senior analytical modelers, quality engineers, quality leadership, and the corporate metrics team. During the summer you will gain exposure to some of Quality’s top executive leadership.

The Role:
You’ll be working on high priority analytics projects tied to Quality with the goal to:
  • Improve Quality performance
  • Provide new and accurate measures to evaluate the customer experience
  • Expanding the Quality organization’s digital transformation leveraging advanced analytics
In partnership with our lead modelers you'll apply:
  • Predictive modeling
  • Data mining
  • Optimization
  • Machine learning
  • Forecasting

Don’t just work here, Thrive here.

#LI-MP1

At ActionIQ we are building the most scalable Customer Data Platform (CDP) in the market. What in the world is a CDP? A CDP is a platform that enables employees across your organization, from marketing to product to analytics, to more deeply understand their customers in order to build and deliver better experiences across a wide array of channels (mobile, email, web, etc).

In order to be the best in class CDP we need

  • An infinitely scalable generalized data solution that can ingest and process data from our growing list of customers.
  • A clean, beautiful, and intuitive UI & API that abstracts away the data complexity to help customers discover the information that is important to them.


Our Fullstack engineering teams are focused on building out and expanding the capabilities of (2). While on the team you’ll dive deep into the world of TypeScript and React and come to learn that the Chrome inspector is your best friend. We’re looking for engineers that like not only dealing with the fine details of pixel perfect CSS but also thinking about API and data model designs to support our platform.

As a member of our engineering team the “intern” in your title will quickly fade away. We provide interns with real opportunities that will have an impact on our product and by the end of the summer ship a feature to production to our clients. While with us you’ll have an opportunity to:

  • Partner with Product and UX to design a solution to a problem in our platform that will positively impact our customers
  • Architect the technical specifications of what you will build
  • Work closely with those around you to build, test, and deploy the solution


At ActionIQ we use a wide range of technologies including, but not limited to Scala, Thrift, Kafka, TypeScript, React, Terraform, and Play Framework. If that list is daunting or you’ve never heard of any of those don’t worry! When you join us as an intern all we expect is an open mind and the excitement to learn and grow. No matter what company you join there will always be new technologies. Over the course of the summer we want to help you grow your skill set while also giving you a chance to have an impact on our product and clients - and it doesn’t hurt to have some fun while doing it.

Although we are currently all working remotely we hope to be back in our office by next summer where we have a stocked fridge, cold brew on tap, and an endless supply of snacks. If by chance we are still remote for the summer, our internship will still be on and we’ll make sure you still have an awesome summer.

Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a BS in Computer Science or similar program with planned graduation of December 2021 or May 2022
  • Experience with JavaScript and/or TypeScript
  • Interest in building UI & APIs
  • Previous internship experience at a tech company, personal projects to further learning outside of class, or research experience in a lab.


ActionIQ is committed to building an inclusive, equitable, and diverse organization. We embrace equal opportunity for all applicants and seek to foster a culture of belonging for our employees. We recognize and appreciate that the more inclusive we are, the better we will function as a team. AIQ welcomes qualified applicants of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or family status, disability, military veteran status, and any other status or background. Join us on our journey to build a product that will help our customers deliver memorable experiences that will drive loyalty and growth.

position: Math & ALGO Bell Labs Summer Intern
description:
About Nokia


At Nokia we create the technology to connect the world. Developing and delivering the industry's only end-to-end portfolio of network equipment, software, services and licensing that is available globally. Through our research teams, including the world-renowned Nokia Bell Labs, Nokia is leading the world to adopt end-to-end 5G networks that are faster, more secure and capable of revolutionizing lives, economies and societies. Nokia adheres to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. A truly global company, we are 160 nationalities working in more than 100 countries.



About Nokia Bell Labs


Help change the way people connect with the world…

Bell Labs, the Nobel Prize winning research organization, is accepting applications for our competitive internship program.

Bell Labs defines Nokia’s technological and architectural vision for the ICT industry, identifies the key challenges in this vision and invents solutions that are an order of magnitude (10X) better than existing solutions. It advises the industry on the economics of the vision and underlying technologies, and how best to transform to most efficiently achieve the goals. Driving thought leadership among customers and the industry strengthens Nokia’s role as a market leader and creator.
Discovering the possibilities that shape the human experience are at the heart of everything we do. Our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with world experts, and the best and brightest minds, who solve the most formidable networking and communications challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.
Our researchers are continually massively scaling the capabilities of networks from the data center to the end device, to change the way we live and work, by inventing breakthrough technologies to make networks and systems faster, smarter and greener.

As well as providing hands-on educational and collaborative experiences for a pool of talented and highly motivated students, our internship program will expand your field of study by exposing you to an unparalleled diversity of people, expertise and perspectives. In classic Bell Labs style, you will leave changed forever by an experience that will redefine your future.



Job Description


The Mathematics & Algorithms Research Group at Bell Labs-Research in Murray Hill, New Jersey, USA, invites applications for summer internship positions for Summer 2021. The internships cover research projects in a broad range of topics from stochastic modeling and optimization to deep reinforcement learning and autoencoder theory and applications. Candidates will have a strong and proven background in computing sciences and related fields and a natural interest in innovatively applying fundamental tools and methods in focused problem areas.



Job Responsibilities & Competencies


The successful applicant will conduct research in computing sciences and their applications to emerging network and data science. Primary duties and responsibilities include performing supervised research in math and computing science disciplines, such as computational math, algorithm design and development, (large-scale) optimization, distributed systems, computational methods for large data sets, complex networks, machine learning and deep learning. Familiarity with computational tools and techniques of data science and machine learning is required.


Qualifications


Candidates must hold a master’s degree or equivalent in CS, Computational & Applied Math, OR, ECE, or related fields such as computational physics.


Student Criteria:
Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above.
Must be enrolled as a full-time student.

Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements or may consider sponsoring short-term J1 Visa PhD students dependent upon program requirements.

Education Requested: Must be pursuing a degree in Biochemistry, Biomedical Engineering, Biophysics, Business Modeling, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Microbiology, Nanotechnology, Operations Research, Physics, Statistics, Systems Engineering and Telecommunications from an accredited college/university.



Imagine creating technology that has the potential to change the world. Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people’s lives and help to overcome some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves. Come create the technology to connect the world.

description:
Summary of Role:
GLOBALFOUNDRIES Fab 8 is seeking a skilled and motivated Equipment Engineer to be a part of a manufacturing engineering team engaged in advanced technology at GLOBALFOUNDRIES state of the art 300mm wafer fab (Fab8) in Malta, New York. The primary responsibility of this position is to work as a track equipment engineer. This responsibility includes troubleshooting track related problems, maintaining equipment uptime, and working with the supplier on track improvements.
Essential Responsibilities:
In your role you are responsible for the following. This responsibility includes, but is not limited to:
  • Startup, qualification, and sustaining activity of leading edge Photolithography Coat and Develop Tracks as a Track Equipment Tool Owner to support 14nm technology requirements.
  • Support other fab organizations to ensure the equipment will meet the required cost, quality and reliability metrics.
  • Support technology insertion and improve equipment robustness by providing technical solutions for equipment related yield problems.
  • Work closely with vendors and actively drive projects to improve tool performance to meet fab capacity needs.
  • Work closely with shift teams to provide direction and training for engineers and technicians (maintenance schedule and execution, equipment qualification and documentation).
  • Participate in continuous improvement programs and follow lean manufacturing practices to improve productivity and cost effectiveness.
  • Support Fab8’s efforts in building a world class organization, achieving manufacturing excellence and establishing a team based collaborative culture.
  • Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs.

Required Qualifications:
Enrolled in a B.S. Degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Materials Science, Computer Science or other relevant engineering or physical science discipline.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience in 248nm, 193nm or 193nm Immersion Lithography tools, and processes.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a matrixed global environment.
  • Familiar with equipment engineering, maintenance and troubleshooting concepts.
  • Familiar with FMEA and risk management.
  • Experience in applying LEAN techniques in a manufacturing environment, Lean Six Sigma Certification.
  • Strong equipment troubleshooting and hands-on background. Working experiences with vendors.
  • Knowledge of semiconductor wafer fabrication processes.
  • Experienced in driving improvement projects.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at usaccommodations@globalfoundries.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.
An offer of employment with GLOBALFOUNDRIES is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen, as applicable and subject to applicable laws and regulations.
GLOBALFOUNDRIES is fully committed to equal opportunity in the workplace and believes that cultural diversity within the company enhances its business potential. GLOBALFOUNDRIES goal of excellence in business necessitates the attraction and retention of highly qualified people. Artificial barriers and stereotypic biases detract from this objective and may be illegally discriminatory.

All policies and processes which pertain to employees including recruitment, selection, training, utilization, promotion, compensation, benefits, extracurricular programs, and termination are created and implemented without regard to age, ethnicity, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, sexual orientation,
gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic or category specified by local, state or federal law.

position: DIGITAL CONSULTING INTERN- TAX SERVICES- SUMMER 2021
description:
Who is Grant Thornton?

Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd, one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms. We’ve never been a typical professional services firm. We put people first, and that is what sets us apart.

Why Join Tax Digital Consulting?

At Grant Thornton, our Tax Digital Consulting practice helps drive efficiencies, mitigate business risks, and increase the value of the tax functions of large enterprises. In addition, our team manages, automates, analyzes and visualizes data using data transformation and visualization tools to support process improvement initiatives. We also have a large team that implements for large organizations (through standard or custom integrations) transaction tax engines and tax reporting/compliance technologies, and we provide technical support for these technologies during and after implementation.

We work with complex multinational companies to understand the regulatory landscape and influence business decisions. If you have a desire to think globally in a fast-paced environment and influence important decisions in variety of business functions, then Tax Digital Consulting may be an area for you to consider.

Qualifications

Baseline Requirements

General business knowledge with a strong preference for Accounting Major or Minor
Familiarity with analytics / visualization tools (e.g. Alteryx, DOMO, Power BI, Tableau)
Familiarity with system infrastructure and application design
Database architecture; creating queries and tables using, e.g., Oracle or SQL server
Project management/project life-cycle knowledge and experience with systems/business analysis
Technical/advanced writing skills

Advanced Requirements

Experience with web development techniques
Experience working with back end databases and database management systems
Knowledge of multiple ERP systems and databases (e.g. SAP, Oracle, MSFT)
Transaction tax engine experience (e.g., Vertex, Thomson Reuters, Avalara)
Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation and Blockchain and their impact on the regulatory environment
Programming related coursework
Java, C++ or .NET (C# or VB), R, Python proficiency

Candidate Characteristics

Intellectually curious
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Dynamic thinker who challenges conventional wisdom
Willingness to learn and adopt new technologies
Ability to function within a geographically-distributed team
Good listening skills and the ability to grasp business trends and needs

Applicable Majors:

Accounting degree with Data Science, Analytics, or Information Systems minor
Information Systems or Computer Science degree with Accounting or Business minor
Data Science or Analytics degree with Accounting or Business minor
Software/system engineering

TRAINING:
Grant Thornton LLP provides both local and national training programs related to an individual’s job responsibilities. We are committed to ongoing professional development and we encourage individuals to attend outside training seminars.

BENEFITS:
Grant Thornton LLP offers an outstanding opportunity for career growth and development, an attractive compensation and incentive program, generous benefits including immediate participation in our 401(k) plan, and a flexible work environment that offers individual enrichment opportunities in a team environment.

It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Requisition ID: 048002

Chicago, IL
Chicago, Illinois

Overview:

Business/Operating Units:


Information Technology


Position:


Reports to (title):


PMO Manager or PMO Director


Department:


Information Technology


Employment Status:


Non-Exempt


Summary of Responsibilities:

The Business Analysis Intern will report to the Project Management Office (PMO) and work closely with Business Analysts, Delivery Assurance Analyst, Enterprise Business Analysis Managers, Project Managers, Portfolio Analysts, and PMO leadership to assist in the successful delivery of strategic projects for the Western & Southern Financial Group.

Position Responsibilities:


  • Support PMO Business Analysts while performing Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring, Elicitation and Collaboration, Requirements Life Cycle Management, Strategy Analysis, Requirements Analysis and Design Definition activities in support of Agile, Waterfall, or Hybrid project methodologies on an active enterprise project.
  • Support presentations to groups on the Business Analysis Center of Excellence services, including the Business Analysis Community of Practice, Team Roles, Key Deliverables, and other PMO functions.
  • Participation in PMO and project team meetings, organizational events and activities, training support services, and other duties as assigned by management.

Selection Criteria:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong problem solving/analytical skills.
  • Good time management and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement.
  • Ability to work in a team setting.
  • Ability to multitask and manage priorities.
  • Ability to perform assigned tasks accurately and on time.
  • Ability to grasp new business and technical project topics rapidly.
  • Ability to apply academic knowledge, such as business, data, and design analysis methods, writing, speech, visual presentation, critical thinking, and process improvement methods in a practical manner.
  • Ability to learn and apply Business Analysis processes as part of the Project Management Life Cycle (PMLC).

Work Setting:


  • This position works in an office setting at a desk or conference room, with a computer and other standard office equipment, and remains in a continuous stationary position for long periods. Position requires substantial movement of wrists, hands and fingers for computer work.


Educational Requirements:


  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree-seeking program with a demonstrated business technology aptitude.
  • Majoring in Business, Information Technology, or Computer Science, is preferred.

Computer Skills and Knowledge of Hardware & Software Required:


  • Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Visio, SharePoint, and Webex Teams, is preferred.

Certifications & Licenses (i.e., Series 6 & 63, CPA, etc.):


  • None required.

Position Demands:


  • None required.

Looking for a great place to launch your career? We’re looking for individuals who are ambitious, willing to learn and grow, and who share our values and cultural beliefs. We’ll provide many ways to quickly expand your knowledge, along with programs such as tuition reimbursement to help you keeping moving forward. Whether you are a high school student looking for your first job, a college student seeking a summer internship or a college graduate ready for that challenging first role, SpartanNash offers a fantastic opportunity for a fast start.

A day in the life of an Supply Chain Inventory Control Intern is never the same but, in this role, you can expect to work with our customer relationship management tool Salesforce to ensure on time and accurate delivery to all of our valued customers.

What You’ll Do:

  • Support an integral tool that 629 Associates use for Customer Relationship Management where for example over 200K interactions are captured with our Valued Customers
  • Work with the Top Customer Relationship Management Tool Salesforce in the Nation.
  • Meet the Customer Service Team Leaders to understand their lay of the land
  • Meet with Sales Leaders to understand their area of responsibility
  • Work with Associates from across the Company, either in Sales, Distribution Center, Customer Service, and help them with password resets, some automation (free form text fields to more consistent drop down pick lists or use of workflow to automate repetitive tasks)
  • Review work instructions to become familiar with Salesforce CRM tool usage and update as changes are made.
  • Data Integrity work

Sound Like You? Here’s what you’ll need:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent (GED)
  • Some College Degree (Required to be an active student going into the summer)
  • GPA of 3.0 (Preferred)
  • Pursuing degree in Information Technology or Management of Information Systems
  • Microsoft Excel experience preferred.
  • Strong attention to detail and analytical skills

At ActionIQ we are building the most scalable Customer Data Platform (CDP) in the market. What in the world is a CDP? A CDP is a platform that enables employees across your organization, from marketing to product to analytics, to more deeply understand their customers in order to build and deliver better experiences across a wide array of channels (mobile, email, web, etc).

In order to be the best in class CDP we need

  • An infinitely scalable generalized data solution that can ingest and process data from our growing list of customers.
  • A clean, beautiful, and intuitive UI & API that abstracts away the data complexity to help customers discover the information that is important to them.


Our Distributed Systems engineering teams are focused on building out and expanding the capabilities of (1). While on the team you’ll untangle the complexities of our customers’ data and understand the ins and outs of ingesting terabytes of data every day. We’re looking for engineers that are excited about data scale and building fault tolerant systems which can withstand a surge in traffic.

As a member of our engineering team the “intern” in your title will quickly fade away. We provide interns with real opportunities that will have an impact on our product and by the end of the summer ship a feature to production to our clients. While with us you’ll have an opportunity to:

  • Partner with Product and UX to design a solution to a problem in our platform that will positively impact our customers
  • Architect the technical specifications of what you will build
  • Work closely with those around you to build, test, and deploy the solution


At ActionIQ we use a wide range of technologies including, but not limited to Scala, Thrift, Kafka, TypeScript, React, Terraform, and Play Framework. If that list is daunting or you’ve never heard of any of those don’t worry! When you join us as an intern all we expect is an open mind and the excitement to learn and grow. No matter what company you join there will always be new technologies. Over the course of the summer we want to help you grow your skill set while also giving you a chance to have an impact on our product and clients - and it doesn’t hurt to have some fun while doing it.

Although we are currently all working remotely we hope to be back in our office by next summer where we have a stocked fridge, cold brew on tap, and an endless supply of snacks. If by chance we are still remote for the summer, our internship will still be on and we’ll make sure you still have an awesome summer.

Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a BS in Computer Science or similar program with planned graduation of December 2021 or May 2022
  • Experience working with large datasets
  • Interest in data and distributed systems
  • Previous internship experience at a tech company, personal projects to further learning outside of class, or research experience in a lab.


ActionIQ is committed to building an inclusive, equitable, and diverse organization. We embrace equal opportunity for all applicants and seek to foster a culture of belonging for our employees. We recognize and appreciate that the more inclusive we are, the better we will function as a team. AIQ welcomes qualified applicants of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or family status, disability, military veteran status, and any other status or background. Join us on our journey to build a product that will help our customers deliver memorable experiences that will drive loyalty and growth.

Position Summary

Fidelity & Guaranty ("F&G")—a division of Fidelity National Financial, Inc. ("FNF"), a Fortune 500 company—is committed to helping Americans prepare for and live comfortably in their retirement. Through its subsidiaries, F&G is a leading provider of annuity and life insurance products. For nearly 60 years, we have offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking safety, protection and income solutions to meet their needs.

At F&G, we believe our culture is what makes our company great. In 2019, we received a Top Workplace award, which we credit to our employees' shared cultural values: Collaborative, Authentic, Dynamic and Empowered. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company, while being a great place to work. We recruit talented and committed individuals to join our team, and we provide opportunities for personal and professional growth. The IT Metrics Analyst Intern will assist with technical analysis, data related research and report(s) fulfillment.

Organization

This position reports directly to the IT Infrastructure Support Services Director and interacts with other members of the IT organization.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Produce accurate and standardized reporting
  • Provide reporting that illustrates key insights that communicates operational performance
  • Provide enhancement of ITSM and project metrics that coordinates with industry standards and best practices
  • Communicate and collaborate with other team members, communicate results and status to system owners and service requestors

Experience and Education Requirements

  • Pursuing Associates or Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or a similar field
  • Sophomore (Third) or Senior (Fourth) year student with a 3.0 GPA or above
  • Experience with operating systems and commercial software (MS Office, Adobe, etc.)
  • Demonstrated knowledge of common IT terminology and practices such as but not limited to; ITIL, key performance indicators (KPI), alerting/monitoring systems, data manipulation/data management

Preferred Requirements, Skills and Abilities

  • Hands-on experience across IT domains preferred (i.e. Servers, Network, Databases and/or Application Development, etc.)
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Active Directory, IT related infrastructure
  • A fundamental understanding of data reporting capability (MS Excel (pivot tables)), database manipulation
  • Highly motivated, self-starter and team player with high energy level and willingness to take on responsibility
  • Sound relationship building, collaboration and situational leadership skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to complete duties timely and accurately with minimal supervision
  • Ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and transparently – both verbal and written
  • Ability to continually prioritize and multitask to accomplish goals
  • Ability to generate innovative solutions in work situations
  • Proactively take-action to improve existing processes or conditions
  • Ability to work in fast-pace team environment and handle multiple projects and assignments under tight deadlines

Physical Demands and Work Environment

  • Must be able to work where elevated noise levels are an industry standard
  • Must be able to sit for extended period of time while utilizing a computer or multiple computer monitors

F&G Intern Program:

  • Paid Internship
  • Paid company parking
  • Paid company holidays
  • 401(k) and other outlying benefits as are made available to other similarly situated employees of Fidelity & Guaranty Life, in accordance with and subject to the eligibility and other provisions of such plans and programs.

Want to hear more about F&G's Intern Program? Follow this link to see what past interns have to say!
